loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.en:
Maria Angela J. B. (pictured with her brother) is a 30-year-old single mother. She has two children, 6 and 15, and both are in private school.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. selling produce (bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes and onions) and CDs from her home. For 10 years, Ms. J. has run this store from her home with help from her brother and mother.  

In order to increase sales, Ms. J. would like to move to a higher-traffic area. She is requesting a loan in order to rent a stall on the corner of the main road. Ms. J. hopes that a new locale will allow her to increase her monthly income. She thanks you for supporting her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: To rent a stall

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 6 y 10 años de edad en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 3 años tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, cerca a la estación de autos que brindan servicio de transporte Zaña – Chiclayo y viceversa; en este establecimiento ofrece bebidas gaseosas y golosinas a los chóferes y pasajeros que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos familiares con la que cuentan.

El incremento de la temperatura debido a la proximidad del verano ha hecho que Franco piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para ofrecerle a sus hijas una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Franco is a 32 year-old father who lives with his wife and their two daughters, ages 6 and 10, in the district of Zaña, located 50 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo. For three years, Franco has operated a convenience store in his home, located close to the station that offers transport Zaña - Chiclayo and vice versa. In his establishment Franco sells sodas and candies to the drivers and passengers that frequent the area. The store is the family's only source of income. The rise in temperature due to the approaching summer season gave Franco the idea to expand his business by buying more drinks, and for this reason he is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Franco is a responsible and hard-working father. His greatist wish is to keep working hard to give his two daughters an excellent education.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda drinks to expand convenience store business.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El Sr. Maximo Gómez Z. tiene 46 años de edad vive con su esposa la Sra. Castillo Cahua Liliana de 33 años de edad. Ella tiene un hijo mayor de 11 años de su primer compromiso y con su esposo tiene una hija de 1año. 
Ambos mantienen una relación de 8 años y el Sr. considera al niño mayor como su hijo y se preocupa mucho por las necesidades del hogar. 
Ambos son trabajadores; el Sr. Se dedica al transporte desde hace mas de 10 años ya que cuenta con una unidad propia (TICO) y la Sra. trabaja en forma independiente como cocinera en restaurantes y también para personas que solicitan de su servicio cuando tienen alguna celebración.
Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la Calle 18 de Febrero – Parcona – Ica, antes del terremoto esa vivienda era de adobe con buenos acabados pero lamentablemente con el desastre natural se derrumbo todo entonces ellos han logrado levantar parte de su casa con su esfuerzo.
Solicitan el préstamo para el techado ya que es de calamina y en tiempo de verano eso quema demasiado, también en Perú se acercan la lluvias y no desean que sus hijos vivan lo mismo del año pasado.
Ambos cuentan con buenas referencias, tienen poca acumulación de bienes ya que perdieron todo hace 2 años.
texts.en:
Mr. Maximo Gómez Z. is 46 years old and lives with his wife Mrs. Castillo Cahua Liliana who is 33. She has an 11-year-old son from a prior engagement and with her husband she has a 1-year-old daughter. They have been together for 8 years and Mr. Moisés considers the older son as his own and he worries about the necessities of the family. They both work, he has been in transportation for more than 10 years as he has his own vehicle (TICO) and his wife works independently as a cook in restaurants as well as for individuals who request her service for some celebration. They own their house which is located in Calle 18 de Febrero - Parcona - Ica. Before the earthquake it was made of adobe with well-finished details, unfortunately it was destroyed by the natural disaster but they have succeeded in rebuilding part of their home with their effort. They request a loan to build the roof as it is made of corrugated iron which supplies too much heat in summer. On the other hand the rainy season is approaching in Peru and they do not want their children to have the same experience as last year. They both have good references, but have practically no properties as they were lost 2 years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve dwelling

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Ashura N. from Mbozi. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 4. Ashura has been running a beauty-salon business since 2007. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair and blue hair and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut or braided and made to look like your own.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by two employees. Ashura currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality of her salon. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Ashura thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her salon

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ESCALE depuis le 19 décembre 2001. Avec son prêt elle achète des fruits et fleures d'oseille séchées pour fabriquer et vendre des jus naturels. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fanta S. is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children, all in school. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de ESCALE since December 19, 2001. With her loan, she’s buying fruit and dried hibiscus flowers to make and sell natural juices. She participates in improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her commercial work

loans.name: Edgar Erasmo

texts.es:
El socio EDGAR pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos tres varones y una mujer. Los tres varones son profesionales y la mujer estudia contabilidad en la universidad particular “Andina del Cusco”. El es cesante jubilado.   

El socio tiene una pequeña cabina de Internet donde trabaja a medio tiempo. 

El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar la cabina de Internet y para el gasto familiar
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
EDGAR is a partner of the community bank "MINIBANK". He is from the town of Cusco. He is 63 years old, married with 3 sons and 1 daughter. The three sons ar professionals and the daughter studies accounting at the private university "Andina del Cusco. He is retired and has a small internet café where he works half-time.

The partner needs the loan to improve the internet café and to provide for his family. The partner is grateful for the opportunity and promises to repay the loan punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve an internet café.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Catherine M.. She is 37 years old and is from Mbozi. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 19. Catherine has been running a crops business since 2005, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Catherine currently earns about 80 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Catherine thanks you for your support!


SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41 years old Anna K.  from Mbozi. She is married  with 4  children, between the ages of 4  and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans. Anna has been running a clothes  business since 2006. Client’s business is purchasing clothes in wholesale and selling them in retail. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by 2 family members. Anna currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Celidonia

texts.es:
La señora Celidonia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ankara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Cahuaya, estudio educación secundaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi un año y su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, préstamo que dice lo utilizara comprando ganado ovino para engorde, para luego venderlo en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es poder educar a su niño y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las charlas y los encuentros
texts.en:
Sra. Celidonia is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ankara, Ilave Disrict, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Celidonia lives in the community of Cahuaya and was not able to complete her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost a year. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep.

Celidonia is requesting a new loan of 600 soles to buy additional sheep for fattening. She will sell the animals later at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to provide her child with an education and continue working. She enjoys her savings, the seminars, and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Esta M. from Mbozi. She is married with three children between the ages of four and 13. Esta has been running a shop since 2005. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week.  Esta currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality and range of her products. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Esta thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Esta N. from Mbozi. She is married with three children between the ages of two and six. Esta has been running a crops business since 2008, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Esta currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Esta thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To contract labour help and purchase fertlizers.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Eva M. from Mbozi. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 20. Eva has been running a crops business since 2003, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Eva currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Eva thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudió educación secundaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes nuevas para mejorar su negocio de la pesca artesanal que lo realiza 2 veces por semana.  La señora también se dedica a la chacra.

Su mayor deseo es poder poner un hospedaje en Ccotos.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades y los prestamos y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. Nelly lives in Ccotos and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Nelly is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 soles to buy new nets to improve her fishing business. In addition to making fishing trips twice a week, she is also very active on her farm. Her greatest wish is open a lodge in Ccotos. She enjoys the simplicity of the loans and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up food products and resupply her shop

loans.name: Una Luz En El Camino Group

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia B., una joven madre de 20 años teje mantas desde hace dos años, aprendió esta habilidad de su madre desde muy pequeña. Maria compra sus insumos o materia prima como la tela y el fleco de una distribuidora que está en la ciudad de La Paz, después de tejer y producir los vende a una comerciante que a su vez lleva estos productos a Desaguadero. Ella desea ampliar su negocio subiendo el nivel de producción y necesita comprar materia prima.
Sus compañeras del grupo Una Luz en el Camino tienen diversos negocios como la venta  de frazadas, comida, ropa, muebles y otros.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia B. is a young mother who is 20 years of age. She has been weaving shawls to earn a living for the past two years. Maria learned this skill from her mother when she was very little. She buys her supplies and materials, such as fabric and fringe, from a distributor in La Paz. After she produces her shawls, Maria sells them to a trader who in turn ships the products to Desaguadero. She wants to expand her business by increasing her production level, but she needs the necessary materials in order to do this.

Her fellow members of the group “Una Luz en el Camino” (A Light in the Road) have different businesses such as selling blankets, food, clothing, furniture, and other products. They all need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods & materials

loans.name: Faithful Friends Group

texts.en:
Esther T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faithful Friends. She is 43 years old and a widow with three children aged 2-26 years old. Their educational levels are kindergarten through high school graduate. Esther also cares for a grandson. She is an 11th grade dropout due to eyesight problem so she decided to get into business. Esther and her family live and work in the Steven Tolbert estate, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.
Her business is the sale of rice and charcoal. She buys rice and charcoal from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of Barnesville estate, northern Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for six years and hopes to improve to a shop.
Esther talks to her customers in a good manner and sells at affordable prices in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. She started by selling cooked fufu (a local Liberian dish) with LD$75.00. She needs this loan to purchase more rice and charcoal. Esther dreams of giving her children a better education and a plan for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and charcoal.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: D. Victorine est née le 21 Juillet 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Victorine vit au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, depuis une trentaine d'année. C'est une divorcée ayant à sa charge cinq enfants, dont trois sont ses propres enfants et qui sont tous scolarisés. Victorine vit avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Victorine a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire, et depuis près de 28 ans, elle mène comme activité, la vente de divers (conserves, insecticides, savons, allumettes, omo, maïs, riz,etc.) ainsi que la vente de boissons alcoolisées à son domicile. Victorine fait ses amplettes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Victorine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Victorine D. was born on July 21, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For about thirty years, she's been living in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Cotonou. She's a divorcee who has five school-attending children to support, out of which three are her own. Victorine lives with her children and support the family on her own. She attended school up to secondary level and, for almost 28 years, she's been selling various items (canned food, insecticides, soaps, matches, laundry detergent, corn, rice, etc) as well as alcoholic beverages at her house. Victorine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, and she repays her loans without problems. In order to expand her business and better meet customer demand, she's seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (boxes of soaps, canned food, sacks of rice, corn)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Ann

texts.es: Ann es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son mayores de edad. Ann se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es cerrajero. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de insumos para vender salchipapas (comida al paso).  Este crédito de 1500 soles, será invertido en la compra de artículos de lencería para venderlos. La meta de Ann es llegar a tener un negocio de plásticos.
texts.en:
Ann is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. She is 46 years old, and the mother of four children of whom two are adults. Ann manufactures clothing in the small sewing workshop located in her home. She has the support of her husband, who works as a locksmith.

She joined the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank four years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase ingredients for preparing and selling “salchipapas” (a form of fast food consisting of potatoes and sausages). This loan in the amount of 1500 soles will be used to buy lingerie items to sell. Her goal is to have a business selling plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Helena M. from Mbozi, married with two children aged three and seven. Helena has been running a medical store since 2004, working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and assisted by one employee. Helena currently earns about $120USD per month from her business, and she is requesting a loan in order to purchase medicines in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve both the quality and range of her products. Helena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in bulk

loans.name: Leonza Maria

texts.es: Leonza Maria es casada, tiene 2 niños: 1 de 9 años estudiando la primaria y una bebita de 6 meses de edad, trabaja en el sistema penitenciario de Juigalpa como sub-alguacil reeducadora desde hace 6 años, esta solicitando su 7mo refinanciamiento para mejora de vivienda, actualmente habita en casa de sus suegros, y desea darle condiciones al lugarcito que tiene, pues no tiene piso y quiere poner la ceramica en la salita y construir un cuarto para asi brindar mejores condiciones a sus hijos y mas a la pequeñita que esta inquieta por aprender a dar sus primeros pasitos.  Leonza es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecino, y tiene el sueño de que sus hijos estudien y puedar ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Leonza Maria is married with 2 children, a 9-year-old in elementary school and a 6-month-old baby girl. She has been working for 6 years in the penitentiary system of Juigalpa as a re-educating sub-sheriff. She is requesting her 7th loan to improve her house. Presently she is living with her in-laws and she wishes to improve the conditions of their small house as it has no floor. She wants to put ceramic in the living room and build a room to offer better conditions to her children especially to the little one who is anxious to start walking. Leonza is well-liked by her fellow workers and neighbors and it is her dream that her children study and become good individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room and place ceramic floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour and oil in order to make and sell doughnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, soap, cooking oil, sugar and salt in bulk

loans.name: Iveth Magdalena

texts.es:
la joven Iveth Magdalena O. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos. su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi esta trabajando y cuidando a sus hijos.
Iveth vive frente a un campo de futbol, todas las tardes hace sus golosinas y las vende a varias personas que van a jugar a dicho campo.
casi todas las tardes muchas personas van a jugar a este campo y ahi es cuando tiene muchas ventas de refrescos y jugos.
Iveth esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas refrescos y materiales para hacer las golosinas ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y no se da abasto con lo que tiene, muchas veces deja de vender por no tener golosinas.
nos comento que su sueño es remodelar su casa y terminarla para darles un hogar digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Iveth Magdalena O. is a 24-year old single mother with two children and works selling fast food and beverages. She runs her business out of her house, so that she can work and care for her children. Iveth lives near a soccer field and every afternoon she makes food and snacks and sells them to the people who come to play. Almost every day there are many pepole at the field, sot hat is when she is busiest selling lots of sodas and juices. Iveth is applying for a loan to buy more soda and supllies to make fast food because the demands are so high and she doesn't have enough product. Many days she has to stop selling because she runs out of food. She says that her dream is to remodel her house and finish it in order to give a dignified home to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of supplies, food products and beverages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Teonila

texts.es:
Teonila es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la comercialización de anticuchos (meat kabob) y pollo frito en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Cayaltí. Su esposo le ayuda a preparar los alimentos y ella los vende por las tardes. Eventualmente su esposo es contratado como cocinero. Con estos ingresos ellos sustentan la econonomía de su hogar.

La buena sazón con la que prepara los platos que ofrece y la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes han hecho que su negocio poco a poco tenga más demanda por lo que Teonila está pensando en ampliarlo, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez  Edpyme Aternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de los insumos que necesita para lograr su objetivo.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales exitosos por eso siempre se esfuerza en su trabajo para sacarlos adelante. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona.
texts.en:
Teonila is 43 years old, and she lives with her husband and four children in the district of Cayaltí, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She and her husband work making kabobs and fried chicken in the plaza in the city of Cayaltí. Her husband helps her prepare the food and she sells it in the afternoon. Sometimes, her husband is hired as a cook. With this income they provide for their home. The good seasoning Teonila uses when preparing the dishes and the quality of service she provides her customers has made her business grow little by little. Now with so much demand Teonila is thinking of expanding her business, but she does not have enough capital to do this. This is why she is applying for a loan for the first time with Edpyme Aternativa. The loan of 500 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of supplies that she needs to achieve her goals. Her dream is to see her children become profesionally successful, and she works hard in order to help them advance. She is well known and held in high esteem by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies, food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other products

loans.name: Delvy Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Delvi Marina E. tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Jicaro Galan municipio de Nacaome Valle, tiene 24 años años de vivir en ese lugar.
Delvi se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones y mariscos, esta actividad la realiza en su comunidad y en aldeas cercanas, sus hijos les ayudan a cargar su mercaderia despues de horarios de escuela. 
su deseo es tener su propio local en el mercado municipal de Nacaome o San Lorenzo
Delvi quiere enseñar a sus hijos el negocio y que ellos puedan salir adelante en un futuro.
ahorita desea invertir en ropa ya que se hacerla la epoca de navidad y en estos dias las ventas son muy buenas, quiere comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delvi Marina E. is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two children; she has lived for 24 years in the community of Jicaro Galan in the municipality of Nacaome, Valle. Delvi works selling clothing, lotions, and seafood. She works in her town and in nearby villages. Her children help her carry her merchandise after school. Her wish is to have her own store in the market of Nacaome or San Lorenzo. Delvi wants to teach her children the business so that they can continue to improve their quality of life in the future. Now she wants to invest in the purchase of clothing because it will soon be Christmas time because it is the season with the highest sales. She wants to buy wholesale clothing for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Remigia

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA REMIGIA Q. D. B. tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito D. FLORENCIA D. MORA, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú, pero natural D. Huamachuco. Maria no tuvo oportunidad D. estudiar, dado que tenia labores que realizar para ayudar a su familia, quienes vivian en extrema pobreza. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA. La socia está casada y tiene 8 hijos, solo una depenD. D. ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta D. menu (alimentos), los prepara sobre pedidos y los lleva a repartir por las zonas aledañas, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró ollas grandes para implementar su negocio.
Con este crédito D. 800.00 nuevos soles comprará dos mesas grandes y 24 sillas D. plástico, así como también platos D. porcelana y cubiertos. 
Maria sueña con tener su propio restaurante, y aprender a administrarlo, con ello logrará mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su hija D. 22 años que sufre D. retardo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Remigia Q. D. B. is 72 years old and lives in the District of Florencia D. Mora in Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is originally from Huamachuco. Maria did not have the opportunity to attend school since she had to work to help support her family, who lived in extreme poverty. She is a member of La Perbola Communal Bank. Maria is married and has 8 children, one of whom is a dependent.

She sells food that is prepared upon request. With the help of her husband, she also delivers food to the surrounding areas. Maria used her first loan of 300 soles to buy large pots for her business. With this loan of 800 soles, she will purchase two large tables, 24 plastic chairs, porcelain plates, and cutlery.

Maria dreams of having her own restaurant, which she will learn to manage. With this business, she hopes to improve the quality of life for her 22 year old daughter who suffers from mental retardation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, plates, and cutlery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
Rayito de Luna así se hace llamar un grupo de 9 mujeres y 1 varón, que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva se tiene a Maria Luz Fernández como Presidenta,  Beatriz C. como Tesorera y ocupando la cartera de Secretaria de Actas está Fátima Janett O., ellas esperan que el grupo crezca y siga adelante.
Del total de  integrantes cinco se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, es decir, lápiz labial, perfumes, cremas y otros, tres venden CDS, una vende diferentes artículos y otra vende alimento seco o víveres a sus clientas. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y generar mayores ingresos en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
“Rayito de Luna” (Little Moonbeam) is the name of this group consisting of 9 women and 1 man. They have recently gathered together to access a loan. The group’s board of directors is led by Maria Luz Fernández (President), Beatriz C. (Treasurer), and Fátima Janett O. (Secretary). They all hope the group will grow and succeed.

Of all the members, five of them sell cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfumes, crèmes, and other items. Three members sell CDs. One sells a variety of products and another sells dried foods to her customers. They all need to buy merchandise so that they can generate more income from their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the standards of her beauty  salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the soil and pay for plowing

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven Brenda Elizabeth V. C. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive con su madre y estudia enfermeria los fines de semana.
Es comerciante individual, vende ropa de cama, ropa para damas y caballeros y sandalias, necesita un prestamo para la compra de ropa y sandalias para tener suficiente producto en navidad.
con las genancias que ella saca son para ayudarle a su mama en el hogar con alimentos y pagos de servcios publicos, tambien ocupa el dinero para sus estudios.
su meta es poder graduarse y ser una enfermera profesional.
texts.en:
Brenda Elizabeth V. C., 23, is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and is studying nursing on weekends. She is an independent merchant; she sells bed linens, ladies' and mens' clothing, and sandals. She needs financing to buy clothing and sandals to have enough stock available for the Christmas season. The profits she makes are used to help her mother with household expenses, like food and utilities, and she also needs the money to pay for her schooling. Her goal is to graduate and become a professional nurse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens, dress shirts, blouses, underwear, shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: K. Hélène est née en 1974 et est mariée à HOLLO Paul, un agent de l'OCBN au Bénin. Le couple a six enfants en charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants et sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis trois ans de cela au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Hélène supporte avec son mari Paul, les charges de la famille. C'est pourquoi, Hélène a commencé depuis trois ans, la vente de tisane et des canaris au marché de Gbégamey. Hélène fait ses approvisionnements à l'intérieur du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître sa clientèle, Hélène sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Hélène was born in 1974 and is married to HOLLO Paul, an OCBN agent in Benin. The couple has six children to support. Four of them are their own, and they are all in school. The family has been living for three years now in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Hélène and her husband Paul are covering family expenses. This is why Hélène started selling herbal infusions and canaris (earthenware) three years ago at the Gbégamey market. She gets her supplies in Benin’s interior. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. To bolster her working capital and to increase her customer base, she’s requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy earthenware and traditional medicines

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37 years old Selina L. from Mbozi. She is married   with 2  children, between the ages of 8  and 12. Selina has been running a fish  business since 2004. She owns and operates a small stall from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch, and then roasts and sells these fish either in the fish market on along the roads of the city. Given its location along the water, fish is plentiful in the waters around the city and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet.  She is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of $90.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fish in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Selina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Daniel Alfonso

texts.es:
el sr. Daniel Alfonso D. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con  la Sra. Gladys Marina Molina quien se dedica a ser ama de casa. el sr. D. se dedica a la pesca y venta de curiles y pescado, el necesita el credito para comprar una lancha pequeña sin motor, ya que el tiene un motor en muy buen estado que no lo esta utilizando y teniendo una lancha es mejor para realizar su trabajo de pesca.
nos comento que con esta lancha todo va a ser mas facil y va a sacar mas producto del mar.
texts.en:
Daniel Alfonso D., 40, is in a common-law relationship with Gladys Marina Molina, who is a housewife. Mr. D. is a fisherman who sells fish and curiles {Curiles are a local clam with a dark, iron-rich blood. The clams are served raw in their blood mixed with chismol (salsa) and lime juice}. He needs financing to buy a small, motorless boat since he already owns an engine that is in good condition that he hasn't used. Having a boat will help him fish more efficiently. He told us that with this boat everything will be easier and he will be able to extract more product from the sea.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and labor

loans.name: Libbne Elizabeth

texts.es:
Libbne tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos para consumo desde el 2007. Adquiere lotes de 100 pollos de un día de nacidos a un distribuidor de la ciudad de Lima y los cría hasta que tengan 45 dias, luego los distribuye a los establecimientos de venta de carne de pollo del mercado de la ciudad y en algunas bodegas cercanas a su casa.

La demanda por sus pollos ha ido creciendo debido a que los cría con alimentos balanceados y en muy buenas condiciones. Libbne está pensando en comprar un nuevo lote de 150 pollos para ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alterntiva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como productora hasta tener una granja para terminar de construir su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Libbne, 49, is separated and lives with her two sons in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised and sold chickens for consumption since 2007. She buys lots of 100 one-day-old hatchlings from a distributor in the city of lima and she raises them until they are 45 days old. At that point, she distributes them among establishments that sell chicken meat in the city's market and in a few stores near her home. The demand for her chickens has grown because she feeds them nutritionally balanced feed in very good conditions. Libbne is thinking of buying a new lot of 150 chicks in order to enlarge her business but she lacks sufficient funds to do so. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a producer and having a large farm, finishing building her house, and continuing to support her children. She has worked with our institution previously and has shown herself to be a responsible client with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced chicken feed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria incompleta.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace medio año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, capital que será utilizado para la compra de redes y combustible para su bote y así poder realizar su trabajo que es la pesca artesanal, su producto lo comercializa en la feria zonal.

Su mayor deseo es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, married, and has 7 children. Teresa lives in the community of Capana and was not able to finish elementary school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1½ years. Her first loan of 500 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Teresa is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 soles in order to buy nets and fuel for her boat so that she can continue fishing. She sells her catch at the regional fair. Her greatest desire is to provide a good education for her children. She enjoys the Communal Bank meetings and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets & fuel for her boat

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.es:
La socia MARGARITA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos tres varones y una mujer. La socia es cesante jubilada en el sector de educación.      

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de sus menores hijos que están en el colegio y la universidad. Uno de los hijos menores estudia la carrerea profesional de contabilidad en la universidad nacional.

La socia requiere el préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos en la universidad y en el colegio. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita Cortona is a member of the Minibank Communal Bank. She is originally from her hometown of Cusco.

Our client is a 65-year-old, married mother with 4 children—3 sons and 1 daughter. Ms. Cortona is a retired school staff member.

She alternates her household chores with looking after her youngest children, who are in school or university. One of her youngest children is pursuing an Accounting degree at the National University.

Our client needs this loan so that she can keep investing in her children’s college education.

Ms. Cortona is very grateful for the opportunity she has been given by this institute. Moreover, she promises to fulfill her repayment obligations according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in children’s education

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Kpana C. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good Friends. She is 52 years old and a widow with seven children between the ages of 12-25 years old and their educational levels 5th grade -nursing student at the Mother Patten Medical School, in Monrovia, Liberia. Kpana also cares for 12 siblings. She is an illiterate due to her father refusing to send her to school.

Kpana and her family live and work in the Steven Tolbert estate, north of the capital Monrovia, in Liberia. Her business is the sales of prepared food. She buys rice and other cooking ingredients, which she cooks and sells per plate in a little shop to residents of Steven Tolbert  Estate, northern Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 9 years, and hoping to upgrade to a larger shop.

Kpana cooks good food and talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business. She started by selling seasonings like onions, garlic, tomatoes,salt and so on with LD3000.00 

She needs this loan to purchase more rice, oil, dry meat and other ingredients, so that she can cook enough food to serve customers. Kpana dreams of giving her children a better education and saving for her old age.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook for her customers.

loans.name: Milagros Areli

texts.es:
la joven Milagros Areli S. tiene 22 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Yeimi Roney Alvarez
quien labora como bombero de una gasolinra y milagros se dedica a la compra y venta de 
agua en botellones, pescados y camaron.
Milagros necesita el prestamo para comprarse 300 libras de pescado y 20 botellones de agua.
su sueño es que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales.
En esta zona donde vive Milagros que es San Lorenzo se venden mucho los mariscos, ya que es una zona turistica.
texts.en:
The young Milagros is 22 years of age and is married to Yeimi Roney Alvarez, who works as a fireman in a gasoline storage area. Milagros buys and sells water in large bottles, as well as fish and shrimp.

Milagros needs this loan to buy 300 pounds of fish and 20 large containers of water. Her dream is that her children may become good professionals.

In the San Lorenzo area where she lives, they sell lots of shell-fish, since it is a tourist region.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SHELL-FISH, FISH, SHRIMP AND WATER TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her store with merchandise

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 years old Sophia K. from Mbozi. She is married  with 3 children, between the ages of 6 and 12. Sophia has been running a rice  business since 2006. Client’s business is purchasing and selling rice. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week Sophia currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice in bulk for business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product . Sophia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business

loans.name: Carlos Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio CARLOS pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos independientes. El tiene un pequeño taller de manualidades en su domicilio.   

El socio trabaja haciendo manualidades. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades como arreglos navideños, bisutería, pintura de cuadros, etc. El quiere compran más materiales para aumentar la producción de su taller de manualidades.      
    
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
CARLOS, 65, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; he is from the city of Cusco. He is married and has 4 independent children. He has a small crafts workshop in his home. He is a craftsman. He needs financing to increase production and sales of his crafts like Christmas decorations, costume jewelry, paintings, etc. He wants to buy more materials to increase his crafts production. He is very grateful for the opportunity this means affords him and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more materials to increase crafts production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA CONCEPCIÓN G. V. tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Maria estudió hasta 5º de secundaria. La socia es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Maria se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocaditos, le hacen pedidos y los lleva a repartir. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró moldes, harina (en sacos), vainilla, pasas, guindones, chocolate en barra, pasas, etc  para cubrir sus pedidos, los cuales aumentan cada día mas.  Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará moldes para vender panetones grandes y pequeños, los cuales los venderá recorriendo las calles de Trujillo y abastecera bodegas de su distrito. 
Maria sueña con tener su propio stand donde vender sus bocaditos y panetones para la navidad.
texts.en:
MARIA CONCEPCIÓN G. V. is 41 years old, and lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. Maria studied until the 5th year of secondary school. This member is single, and has 3 children who depend on her financially. Maria dedicates herself to making and selling baked snacks, which she creates on order and then delivers to customers. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she bought molds, flour (in sacks), vanilla, raisins, prunes, baking chocolate, etc., to cover her orders which grow each day. With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy molds to make large and small panetones (loaf-like cake, typically served during holidays), which she will sell throughout the streets of Trujillo and to grocery stores in her district. Maria dreams of having her own food stand where she can sell her snacks and panetones for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase molds to make large and small panetones.

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Z. Céline est née en 1965 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Céline est mariée à HEBE Phillippe, un jardinier. Le couple a quatre enfants dont deux sont à leur charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Céline vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Céline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par Céline et Phillippe. Céline n'a jamais fréquenté ; c'est pourquoi depuis une vingtaine d'année, Céline mène comme activité, la vente de divers (savons, insecticides, oeufs, papiers mouchoir, arachide, galettes d'arachide, farine de manioc, etc.) ainsi que la vente de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale) à son domicile. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle, Céline sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Céline Z. was born in Ouidah, an historical town in Benin, in 1965. Céline is married to Philippe HEBE, a gardener. The couple has four children, two of whom they have to support. Not all children attend school. Céline has been living for about twenty years in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She lives with her children and her husband, and they both support the family. Céline never attended school and for about twenty years, she's been selling various items (soaps, insecticides, eggs, tissues, peanuts, peanut cookies, cassava flour, etc) as well as "sodabi" (local alcoholic beverage) at her house. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to expand her business and better meet customer demand, Céline is seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs by the tray, soaps, cassava flour, insecticides, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Foundo Group

texts.fr: Palmarin est un village sérère où la population consomme beaucoup de céréales notamment sous forme de couscous ou de bouillie. Face à cette situation, le groupement des femmes de Foundo a pensé bénéfique de créer une banque de céréales pour la transformation de produits céréaliers. Le prêt acquis, la première tâche sera d’aller acheter dans les marchés hebdomadaires les produits (mil, maïs, sorgho) à bon prix et de les revendre. La seconde sera de transformer les céréales pour disposer d’un produit fini (araw, thiacri, couscous)  bien ensaché qui est un produit très prisé par les villageois.
texts.en:
Palmarin is a village of the Serer people where they consume a lot of grains, especially in the form of couscous or porridge. With regard to this situation, the women’s group Foundo thought it beneficial to create a grain bank for processing cereal products. With the loan in hand, the first task will be to go and buy supplies (millet, corn, sorghum) at the weekly markets at a good price and then to resell them. The second task will be to process the grains to obtain a nicely packaged finished product (araw, thiacri, couscous). These products are highly prized by the villagers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell local cereals

loans.name: Ricardina Graciela

texts.es:
Ricardina tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus tíos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de pescado junto a sus tios, dicho producto es comprado en el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa) para luego ofrecerlo en el distrito de Olmos y sus caseríos. Ella nos cuenta que tuvo que abandonar sus estudios de enfermería en la ciudad de Chiclayo por motivos económicos y ahora trabaja para apoyar al sustento de su hogar.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado para ofrecer a sus clientes por tal motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ricardina es una joven trabajadora y responsable. Su sueño es poder retomar sus estudios de enfermería. En la foto ella nos muestra la mercadería que será vendida al día siguiente.
texts.en:
Ricardina, 21, is single and lives with her aunt and uncle in the Olmos district, which is an hour and forty-five minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past year she has sold fish alongside her relatives. They buy the product from the regional fishing terminal (located in the Santa Rosa district) and later sell in in the Olmos district and surrounding farmsteads. She tells us that she had to abandon her nursing studies in the city of Chiclayo due to financial reasons and now works to help defray household expenses. She would like to enlarge her business buying more fish to offer her customers. For this reason she is requesting her first, 1,000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Ricardina is a hard-working, responsible young woman. Her dream is to be able to restart her nursing studies. In the photo she shows us the merchandise that will be sold the next day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Navidad

texts.es:
El socio NAVIDAD pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos dos varones y tres mujer. 

El socio tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde produce todo tipo de mueble (escritorios, camas, sillas, puertas, etc.) a base de madera. El socio hace 20 años que tiene su taller 

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar la producción de fabricación de muebles de madera. El socio quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales de acabado como tiner, laca, cola, clavos, etc.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NAVIDAD, 56, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; he is from the city of Cusco. He is married and has five children: two boys and three girls. He has a small carpentry workshop where he produces all kinds of wood furniture (desks, beds, chairs, doors, etc.) He has had his carpentry shop for 20 years. He needs financing to increase wood furniture production. He wants to buy more raw materials (wood) and finishing supplies like thinner, lacquer, adhesive, nails, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy finishing supplies for wood furniture.

loans.name: Fiorella Karina

texts.es:
La señora FIORELLA KARINA V. P. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad quien depende de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y también realiza tratamientos faciales a sus vecinas, amistades y familiares en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compró cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, colonias, polvos, rubores, etc.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles, comprará cosméticos como: polvos, cremas, labiales, colonias, rimer, etc y también comprará tintes y cremas de cutis para realizar limpiezas faciales. Fiorella  sueña con tener su propio centro de belleza para así poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder  cubrir todas las necesidades de su bebe.
texts.en:
FIORELLA KARINA V. P. is 24 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. The member belongs to the “Enterprising Women for Success II” cooperative bank. She studied until the 5th year of secondary school, is married, and has a 1-year old child who depends on her. The member dedicates herself to selling cosmetics, and also provides facial treatments to her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances in her area. She used her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles to buy cosmetics such as: lipsticks, creams, colognes, talc, blushes, etc. With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy beauty products such as: talc, creams, lipsticks, colognes, etc., and also to buy skin potions and creams for facials. Fiorella dreams of opening her own beauty store in order to increase her earnings and support all of her baby’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics such as powders, creams, lipsticks, colognes, etc., and also skin potions and creams for facials.

loans.name: Felipa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Felipa habita en la comarca de villa Alvarez de Nueva Guinea, tiene 2 niños menores de edad, los cuales estudian la primaria en la comunidad de la comarca Los Monos de Villa Alvarez, se dedica a las actividades productivas del campo, requiere comprar 2 vacas paridas para aumentar su hato ganadero y poder logra mayor producción de leche y recibir mayor ingreso económico para de esta forma ayudar a mejorar la dieta alimenticia del núcleo familiar, ella comercializa su producción su producción a la planta procesadora Lacteos del Triunfo Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja en coordinación con ella en la actividad agropecuaria y agrícola, también él colabora en las actividades del hogar, Felipa es una mujer ejemplar, emprededora,  responsable, honesto, humilde, reconocida en la comarca, su mayor sueño es estar bien de salud y en el futuro dejar un buen inventario de ganado para sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones de vida para el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Felipa S. lives in the Villa Alvarez de Nueva Guinea region. She has two underage children who attend elementary school in the Los Monos de Villa Alvarez region. She works in agriculture and needs to purchase 2 recently calved cows so that she can increase the size of her herd, thus producing a greater amount of milk and obtaining bigger profits to help with her family expenses. She sells the milk to dairy processors in Triunfo Nueva Guinea. Her husband works with her in farming and agriculture, but he also collaborates with the household chores. Felipa is an exemplary, enterprising, responsible, honest and humble woman who is well-known in the area. Her greatest wish is to be healthy and to be able to leave a great amount of livestock for her children in the future, providing her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase recently calved cows for milk production

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Satta S. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called United Women. She is 44 years old, a widow and mother of two children age 24 and 27 years old whose education levels are 11th grade and high school graduate. Satta also cares for a nephew and a niece. Satta is illiterate due to poverty.

Satta and her family live and work in the Freeport community,a community that has too many petty traders, close to the seaport of Monrovia, north of the capital of Liberia, Monrovia.

Her business is the sale of hardware.She buys hardware from importers and sells retail to buyers around Monrovia. She has been running this business for 22 years and she hopes to build to a store.

Satta talks to her customers in a good manner and gives them affordable prices to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business; but started by selling food ingredients like pepper and bitter ball.

She needs this loan to purchase more hardware to improve her business. Satta dreams of giving her children a better education so as to improve their living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware to improve business.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: A. Rosine est née en 1965 et réside depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une divorcée ayant à sa charge six enfants, dont cinq sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent à Gbégamey avec Rosine. Rosine supporte seule les charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Rosine mène comme activité la blanchisserie depuis dix ans et vend également des vivres à son domicile. Rosine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé ses crédits antérieurs. Rosine souhaite agrandir son activité, afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. C'est pourquoi, Rosine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Rosine was born in 1965 and has been residing for 12 years in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a divorcée having six children to support. Five of them are her own. All of them are in school and live in Gbégamey with her. Rosine is the sole supporter of the family. To manage this, she has been running a laundry business for ten years, and she also sells staple foods out of her home. She supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. Rosine is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans. She wishes to expand her business in order to do better in providing for her children. This is why she’s requesting another ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and staple foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up corn and resell it later

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es:
Juan tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 29 años de dedica a la reparación de artefactos electrodomésticos (televisores, grabadoras, planchas, etc.) en un pequeño local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. Su trabajo es muy solicitado y es la única fuente de ingresos del hogar.

La contínua demanda de sus servicios ha hecho que su stock de repuestos con los que repara los electrodomésticos se agote poco a poco, por lo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles para renovar su stock de repuestos y poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes con normalidad.

Su más grane anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos estudios profesionales para que puedan asegurarse un futuro exitoso. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anterioremente demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years of age, married, and lives with his wife and 3 of their 4 children in the District of Olmos, located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 29 years he has dedicated himself to repairing domestic electrical appliances (televisions, tape players, irons, etc.) from a small shop located in the center of the city. His work is much solicited and is the only source of family income.

The continuous demand for his services has, little by little, diminished his stock of replacement parts for use in repairing appliances. For that reason, he has asked EDPTME Alternative for a credit of 1000 new sols to replenish his stock of replacement parts, so that he can continue normal services to his customers.

His greatest hope is to be able to offer his children professional studies so that they can be assured of future success. He has worked with our Institution previously, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY REPLACEMENT PARTS FOR REPAIRING DOMESTIC APPLIANCES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on bean, charcoal, wheat, and oil

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio ABEL pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero.

El socio estudia la carrera profesional Turismo en el Instituto Superior “ESITUR”. El actualmente es practicante en un agencia de viajes como counter, brinda información a los turistas acerca de los paquetes de viajes como de Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Vilcabamba, etc. 

El socio requiere el préstamo para sus estudios y para comprar un equipo de viaje pues es necesario para sus prácticas como guía de turismo. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ABEL, 25, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; he is from the city of Cusco and is single. He is a student at the "ESITUR" Superior Institute, majoring in Tourism. He is currently working as an intern at the counter in a travel agency. He offers tourist information on package tours to Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Vilcabamba, etc. He needs financing to pay for his studies and to buy camping equipment that is required for his field assignments as a tourist guide. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses and to buy camping equipment.

loans.name: Naïmatou

texts.fr: B. Naïmatou est née en 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Naïmatou réside au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou il y a de cela 50 ans. Mariée à ADE Jean-Claude, un agent à la SOBEMAP au Bénin, Naïmatou est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Naïmatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les dépenses de la famille son supportées ensemble par le couple. Naïmatou a arrêté très tôt l'école, et depuis une vingtaine d'année, elle vend des divers (conserves, savons, bombons, biscuits, galettes d'arachide, farine de manioc, sucre, condiments de sauce, etc.) à son domicile. Naïmatou fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'agrandir le volume de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Naïmatou sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé. Naïmatou envisage plus tard acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Naïmatou B. was born in 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's been residing in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Cotonou for fifty years and she's married to Jean-Claude ADE, a SOBEMAP (Benin port handling company) employee. Naïmatou is the mother of two children, of whom one attends school. She lives with her children and her husband. Both she and her husband support the family. She dropped out of school early on, and for about twenty years, she's been selling various items (canned food, soaps, candies, biscuits, peanut cookies, cassava flour, sugar, sauce condiments, etc) at her house. Naïmatou gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market place in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who previously benefited from two loans which were repaid without problems. In order to bolster her business and meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she's seeking a third loan from Alidé. Later, she envisions buying a plot of land.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, soaps, candies, biscuits, peanut cookies, cassava flour, sugar)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario José es casado, tiene 3 niños menores de edad, 2 estudian la primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er credito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construir una habitacion), labora en construcción de vivienda y también realiza actividades al agrícola en la colonia La Fonseca; Mario José es un hombre humilde, trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de seguir adelante, este cliente con los créditos que le ha brindado AFODENIC ha realizado siempre mejora en vivienda  y en esta ocasion espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA, esta agradecido con la institución por el servicio recibido, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y salir adelante con su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Mario José is married and the father of three minor children; two are elementary school students. He is requesting refinancing of his third AFODENIC loan to invest in his home (build a room). He works in housing construction and also does some farming activities in the La Fonseca neighborhood. Mario José is a humble, hard-working, responsible man who very much wishes to get ahead in life. With his prior financing from AFODENIC he has always improved his home and he hopes on this occasion to be a beneficiary of KIVA fund. He is grateful to the institution for the services received. His dream is to have a pretty home and to get ahead in life with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on corn and ensure a constant supply of fish

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es:
La socia WENDY pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos una hija mujer y un bebe de un año y medio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
WENDY, 31, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; she is from the city of Cusco. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children, a girl and an 18-month-old baby boy. She alternates her household chores with tending her small wholesale and retail fruit sales business in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs financing to increase her working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in fruit selling business.

loans.name: Felicitas Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito de Azángaro de la Región Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y estudió hasta el 5to año de secundaria.
Felicitas Emiliana viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue S/. 300.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado vacuno.
En la actualidad requiere de un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 (nuevos soles), el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno mejorado. Paralelamente la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de abarrotes, para ello comprará arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, etc. 
Su mayor deseo es progresar, ser mayorista, además contar con ganado vacuno mejorado. 
Referente a su Banco Comunal, ella manifiesta que le gustan los ahorros y utilidades producto del ahorro.
texts.en:
