Felicitas Emiliana is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” cooperative bank in the Azángaro district of the Puno region. She is 40 years old, married, has 3 children, and she studied until the 5th year of secondary school. Felicitas Emiliana has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Presently, she needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy better livestock. Concurrently, this member dedicates herself to selling groceries, and for this will buy rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. Her greatest wish is to make progress, become a wholesaler, and also to have high-quality livestock. With regard to her cooperative bank, she notes that she likes to save and the benefits of having a savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock, as well as groceries such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable area and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos Benedicto

texts.en:
Carlos Benedicto S. C. is 48 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Although he has been married for 24 years, he and his wife are currently separated. They have three grown children, the two younger children, 16 and 22, still live with him.

Mr. S. has 15 years of experience in auto repair and he has owned his auto shop for 2 years. His shop offers oil and filter changes, mechanical repair and accessory sales.

Due to the energy crisis in Ecuador, Mr. S. must work an unpredictable schedule between 6 am to 10 pm (depending on when the electricity in the city turns on and off).

Mr. S. is requesting a loan to buy cement, as he would like to add proper walls to the bedrooms in his home (which is attached to his repair shop). In the future, he hopes to get water access to his home. He thanks you for any support!

loans.use: To buy cement to improve his  home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cassava growing area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia DORIS pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo que estudia en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client, Doris, is a member of the Siempre Adelante Communal Bank. She is originally from her hometown of Cusco.

Doris is a 31-year-old woman with a live-in partner and a school age son.

She alternates her household chores with attending to her wholesale and retail fruit business in the Virgen Asunta Market in the city of Cusco.

Doris needs a loan in order to increase her business capital.

Our client is very grateful for the opportunity she has been given by this institute. Moreover, she promises to fulfill her repayment obligations according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for fruit business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is an established businesswoman who has been running her jewelry business for over five years. She says that December always brings her more customers, so she needs to stock up on inventory to meet her customers' needs. She likes working for herself because it allows her more flexibility to spend time with her family and be able to pick her nine-year-old daughter up from school. For Amalia, the most important thing is having enough time for her family. She sends remittances to her father back in Mexico every month.

Sometimes Amalia is challenged because she sells her larger items to customers on credit or in installments. As she explains in her video, sometimes clients do not pay on time or at all, but this happens very rarely and Amalia believes it's important for customer service to trust the customer. She is also planning to enroll in computer classes at her local library so that she can learn to use software to organize her bookkeeping. 

Amalia found out about ACCION USA through a course that she took on starting a small business. She has been very happy with her experience. She has borrowed five loans from ACCION USA and repaid them all perfectly.

loans.use: To buy new gold jewelry for the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael has been in the taxi business for fifteen years. After renting for many years, he decided to purchase a taxi.  

When he bought his taxi, Rafael found no options for financing other than a high-interest loan from an informal moneylender, also known as a "prestamista" or "loan shark." Because these loans have a very high interest rate -- between 60-120% APR (sometimes charged weekly) -- many borrowers, like Rafael, cannot stay current with payments. Rafael was paying several hundred dollars a week just in interest. He is currently asking for an ACCION USA loan to help pay off this predatory debt for his taxicab and begin to improve his livelihood. 

He has a very long-standing relationship with his taxi company and, in the future, he hopes to have a taxi corporation of his own with 20-30 drivers! In this video, he talks about how he started out as a "taxista" and how he purchased his vehicle.

loans.use: To pay off high-interest predatory debt for a taxi

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la señora Blanca V. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Marlon Joneli Rodas quien trabaja en una llantera,  tienen 03 hijos, Blanca se dedica a la compra venta 
de lacteos, leche para hacer charamuscas y churros. tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, asi pasa pendiente de sus hijos que estan pequeños, en el lugar donde vive Blanca la temperatura es bien elevada, casi siempre esta entre los 35 a 40 grados, esto hace que las personas busquen productos helados y las charamuscas se venden bien.
esta solicitando el prestamo para compra de 4 cargas de maiz, maisillo, 100 libras de quesillo, y 100 de mantequilla.
su meta es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda vender de todo tipo de productos lacteos.
texts.en:
Blanca Velásquez, 29, is in a common law marriage with Marlon Joneli Rodas. He works in a tire shop. They have three children. Blanca buys and sells dairy products, milk to make popsicles, and churros. She has her business in her house. That way she can take care of their children, who are small. In the place where Blanca lives the temperature is high, almost always between 35 to 40 degrees. This makes the people look for frozen products, and the popsicles sell well. She is asking for a loan to buy four loads of corn, sorghum, 100 pounds of “quesillo” (local cheese), and 100 of butter. Her goal is to be able to have a large store where she could sell all types of dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, fruit, bags, churros, "quesillo" (local cheese), butter, and corn

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
la señora Ana R. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Felipe Cruz quien labora vendiendo agua y jugos en su carrito en barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, la señora R.
es muy emprendedora y dinamica siempre ha realizado actividades de comercio con su esposo, asi ha podido salir adelante ella y su familia. Ana vende herbalife en su casa tiene muy buena clientela. esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar medio fardo de ropa usada, calzado, agua, jugos y producto herbalife.
su sueño laboral es ser la mejor supervisora de ventas de herbalife.
texts.en:
Ana R., 58, lives in a common law marriage with Felipe Cruz. He works selling water and juices from his cart in the neighborhoods and areas surrounding San Lorenzo. Mrs. R. is very enterprising and dynamic. She has always worked in commerce with her husband. That way she has been able to get herself and her family ahead. Ana sells Herbalife in her house. She has very good customers. She is asking for the loan to buy half of a bundle of used clothes, footwear, water, juice, and Herbalife products. Her dream for work is to be the best sales supervisor for Herbalife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy water in bags, juice, shoes, and Herbalife products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, este cliente se dedica arduamente a laborar con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar compuesto por su esposa y por sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar a los que le debe proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

El se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su familia y para ello ha solicitado un crédito porque requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque se ha encontrado muy maltratada y necesita brindarles a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir. Es por esta razón que espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar los materiales de construcción y así dar lugar al trabajo en el cambio de techo y reparación del piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua this client works arduously to support his household, which is comprised of his wife and their three school aged children. He needs to provide them with the necessary living conditions. He has worried about the well being of his family. That is why he is asking for a loan. He needs to improve their home’s condition. It is battered, and he needs to provide his children with a decent roof to live under. That is why he hopes the loan is granted so that he can immediately buy the construction material. That way the work to change the roof and the floor repair on his house can start.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Richard Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Richard Martínez se dedica arduamente a laborar para llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación puesto que necesita mucho de él porque requiere el cambio del techo porque ha estado muy dañado y es de importancia realizar dicho cambio para así brindarle a sus hijos y esposa las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

El señor Richard ha solicitado el crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción y de esta manera dar lugar a la obra para que al final de todo, su familia pueda tener un techo digno donde habitar y juntos puedan salir adelante como familia.
texts.en:
Richard Martínez works very hard to provide wellbeing for his household. However, his house requires much from him because its roof, which is very damaged, needs to be replaced. It is important to do this so that his wife and children can have the proper living conditions. Richard is seeking financing to buy the building materials needed to provide his family with a proper home to live in so together they can get ahead as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Como toda madre responsable, en la ciudad de Managua la señora Maritza Gaitan se esfuerza laborando para brindarle a su pequeño hijo las condiciones para su desarrollo. Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda porque a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, dicha vivienda ha estado maltratada por lo que ha llegado el momento de invertir en su respectiva reconstrucción.

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de hierro, cemento y bloque y una vez que tenga estos materiales de construcción podrá llevar a cabo la obra de construcción y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Like any responsible mother, Managua resident Maritza Gaitan , exherts herself working to provide her young son with living conditions which will lead to his proper development. She needs to invest in her home because, as time has gone by, her house has been damaged and now she needs to invest in repairs and rebuilding. The financing she is requesting will be used to buy iron, cement, and concrete blocks. Once having the materials, construction may proceed and her children will then have the necessary conditions to develop properly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta  de condimentos.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar condimentos, como  ají, orégano, etc. También vende gaseosas o frutas de acuerdo a la época y lo comercializa en la plaza de Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Juchuy Child” cooperative bank, located in the Capachica district of the Puno province. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She studied until primary school, but did not complete her education. This lady has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 1 year. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which allowed her to increase the capital base for her business selling condiments. Presently, she needs a new loan of 300 soles that will allow her to buy other condiments such as peppers, oregano, etc. She also sells soft drinks or fruit, depending on the season, at the plaza in Capachica. Her greatest wish is to have a well-stocked store. She appreciates being able to save and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments such as peppers, oregano, etc.

loans.name: Militina

texts.es:
la señora Militina D. F. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de queso, quesillo y mantequilla, vive en union libre con el señor Manuel Enrique Gallardo, no tinen hijos. Su negocio es vender lacteos y esta ubicado en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, todos los dias va a su puesto a vender su producto, muchas personas visitan el mercado a diario.
esta solicitando el credito para compra de queso y quesillo, ya que en esta epoca las ventas se mejoran y la demanda es mayor.
su sueño es tener varios puestos de venta de quesos y quesillo en varios lugares de San Lorenzo y Nacaome.
texts.en:
Militina D. F., 38, sells cheese, quesillo (a soft cheese), and butter. She lives with her life partner, Manuel Enrique Gallardo, and have no children. She sells dairy products in the new San Lazaro market. She goes to her stall every day to sell her products since many people visit the market daily. She is asking for financing to buy cheese and quesillo since sales tend to increase during this season and demand is greater. Her dream is to have several cheese and quesillo selling stands in varios locations in San Lorenzo and Nacome.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, quesillo (a soft cheese), and butter.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina” ubicado en el  distrito de Platería, Provincia Puno,  Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 01 hijo, vive en el centro poblado de Caritamaya, estudió educación secundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 meses y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y porcino.  La señora también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías.

Su mayor deseo es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Community Bank " Flor Andina" located in the Plateria district in PUno. She is 37 years old, she is single, and she has a little boy. She lives in Caritamaya, and she completed high school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 7 months. Her first loan of S/.300 neuvos soles was used as working capital for her business of livestock resale.

Currently she requires a new loan of S/.300 neuvos soles, and it will allow her to purchase cattle and pork livestock. She also is involved in the making of crafts.

Her greatest wish is to be able to send her kids to school.<./p>

She enjoys saving money and the group meetings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Daysi Esther

texts.es:
la sra. Daysi Esther F. tiene 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de adornos para casas como ser personajes tallados en madera, alcancillas, casitas de barro, barcos, ollas de barro etc.
tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, las ventas son buenas ya que esta ubicada en el mercado nacional de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, este mercado es transitado por muchas personas las cuales le compran sus adornos, las personas le compran su producto porque vende barato y el acabado de los adornos es muy bueno.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar adornos navideños, como ya casi estamos en navidad las personas compran muchos adornos para sus casas. las ventas mejoran en esta epoca.
texts.en:
Daysi Esther F., 56, sells home decorations like wooden carvings of people, piggy banks, earthenware houses, boats, and earthenware pots, etc. She has been doing this type of work for many years. Sales are very good because she in located in the National Market in the city of San Lorenzo. This market is well traveled by many people who buy her decorations. People buy her products because she sells them cheaply, and the finishings on the decorations are very good. She is asking for the loan to buy Christmas decorations. We are almost at Christmas time, and people buy lots of decorations for their houses. Sales improve in this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Christmas decorations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelda Ebil

texts.es: Doña Nelda Ebil es soltera, tiene 2 niños,  una pequeña productora que está solicitando su 1er credito  para invertirlo en compra de ternero desarrollo y aumentar su inventario ganadero, se dedica a la actividad ganadera y agricola desde muy joven obteniendo ingresos económicos que le permiten el sosten familiar.  Nilda Ebil  posee su finca en una comarca de Nueva Guinea la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo del hato gandero, también realiza todas las actividades de sanidad animal y nutricional brindandoles manejo fitosanitario para su inventario ganadero, sus hijos le ayudan al trabajo del campo, ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha dia a dia con su pequeños niños para salir adelante, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva, su mayor sueño es tener buen inventario ganadero, para ayudarle al núcleo familiar y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nelda Ebil is single, and she has two children. She is a small producer who is asking for her first loan. She will buy a calf to raise and increase her cattle inventory. She has worked with cattle and in farming since she was very young. She was able to get income that allowed her to support her family. Nelda Ebil has a farm in the Nueva Guinea region. It has good conditions for raising herds of cattle. She also works in the area of animal health and nutrition. She manages the health for her inventory of cattle. Her children help her with the field work. She is a hard-working woman who fights day to day to get her small children ahead. She hopes to receive a loan from Kiva. Her biggest dream is to have a good inventory of cattle. This will help her family have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four calves

loans.name: Lady

texts.es: La señora Lady  es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años y es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Lady se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que lo realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace tres años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa. Actualmente requiere un crédito de 2500 soles que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como prendas de vestir y zapatos, que los traerá de la ciudad de Lima para vender en Pucallpa. La meta de Lady es  tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida en su casa.
texts.en:
Lady is an active and hard working member, who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and has four young children. She has the support of her husband who works in agriculture. Lady sells drinks and candy, a job she does from home. She has been a member of the "Carmen Cabrejos" communal bank for three years. The first loan she obtained was 300 soles which she used to purchase candy to sell from home. Currently she requires a 2500 soles credit that will be used to purchase merchandise like clothing and shoes, which she will bring from Lima to the city of Pucallpa. Lady's goal is to have a well stocked grocery store at home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase clothing and shoes in Lima

loans.name: Huinona

texts.es: Huinona es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 27 años, es madre de tres menores de edad y su esposo trabaja en una lancha (servicio de transporte).  Huinona tiene una bodega de abarrotes que funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace dos años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una socia muy puntual. El primer crédito que obtuvo en este banco fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas para vender en la vereda de su casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1300 soles que será utilizado para surtir su negocio, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. La meta de Huinona es tener una tienda con todo tipo de artículos y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Huinona is an enterprising and collaborative member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 27 and has three minor children. Her husband works on a small boat (transportation service). Huinona has a convenience store in her house, and she sells groceries there. She has been part of the María Montessori Communal Bank for two years. In her bank she has always been characterized as being a very punctual member. Her first loan from the bank was for 300 PEN. She used it to buy sweets and soft drinks to sell on the path to her house. She now needs a loan for 1300 PEN to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, and noodles, etc. Huinona’s goal is to have a store with all types of products and to keep working to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and noodles, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 34 años, tiene un hijo (menor de edad).  Rosa se dedica a la venta de coconas (fruta de la región) en el mercado de Bellavista, además vende productos de belleza por catálogos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres” desde hace seis años, el primer préstamo que recibió de este banco fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de  coconas al por mayor directamente de los agricultores. Actualmente requiere un crédito de 2000 soles, monto que será utilizado en la compra de sacos de coconas al por mayor. La meta de Rosa es llegar a tener una tienda de pasamanería y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is a dynamic and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 34 and has one child (a minor). Rosa sells “coconas” (a regional fruit) in the Bellavista market. She also sells beauty products by catalog. She has her husband’s support. He works in public transportation. She has been part of the Las Flores de los Próceres Communal Bank for six years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN. She used it to buy coconas wholesale directly from the farmers. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy sacks of coconas wholesale. Rosa’s goal is to come to have a store selling braids and tassels on drapes and upholstery. Also, she wants to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale "coconas" (fruit)

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
			LUZ D. LA ESPERANZA
Hace 3 años empezó su negocio D. productos D. belleza mediante catalogo, negocio que pudo manejarlo muy bien ya que a la vez  tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijos,  es lo que nos manifiesta Nelly J.,  presidenta del grupo. Algo que le agrado D. este negocio a nuestra socia fueron las capacitaciones que tenían en cuanto a belleza  como cuidados D. la piel,  del cuerpo, del cabello y otros.  La socia muy entusiasta,  comparte toda la información con sus compañeras además ayuda a que  también ellas  puedan vender los productos y beneficiarse.
Norma L. se dedica a las confecciones,  ella nos manifiesta que tiene temporadas altas en  las cuales tiene que invertir mucho en  materiales, pero eso no la desanima porque tiene  como objetivo,  crear su propio taller para dar trabajo a otras personas. 
Otra D. nuestras socias que se dedica a las confecciones es la tesorera Esperanza Bazán,  ella tiene un taller en sociedad con una amiga, nos comenta que es un trabajo sacrificado pero tiene sus recompensas,  ya que durante mucho tiempo pudo ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios,  además del pago D. los servicios básicos en casa.
Todos los socios D. la Alcancía Comunal desean mejorar sus negocios en  infraestructura así como también en la compra D. mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  El  préstamo será destinado para la compra D. material D. trabajo y algunos insumos.
texts.en:
Luz D. la Esperanza Communal Bank Three years ago she started her business of selling beauty products by catalog. She was able to run the business very well and at the same time take care of her three children. That is what Nelly J., president of the group, tells us. One of the things that pleases her about the business is the beauty trainings like how to take care of the skin, the body, hair, and other things. She is a very enthusiastic member, and she shares all of the information with her colleagues. She also helps them so that they can sell products and receive the benefits. Norma L. makes clothes. She tells us that she has high seasons when she has to invest a lot in materials. This does not discourage her, because she has her objective of creating her own shop to give work to other people. Another member who makes clothes is the treasurer, Esperanza Bazán. She has a shop in partnership with a friend. She says that you need to sacrifice in this work, but it has its rewards. For a long time she could help her children in their education. Also, she could help with paying for the basic services in the house. All of the members of the communal bank wish to improve the infrastructure of their businesses. They also want to buy better products to offer their customers. The loan is to buy work material and some supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la señora Maria Santos M. A. tiene 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, en su negocio no tiene mucha mercaderia ahora, por eso es que quiere el credito para surtir mas su negocio, tuvo un problema el cual hizo que gastara un dinero, pero ahora ya se esta recuperando y necesita el credito para comprar mas y tener mas ganancias.
Tiene dos hijos, sola a logrado mantenerlos  ya que su pareja no trabaja porque esta enfermo.
ella con su esfuerzo a logrado a hacer su casita para vivir con su familia, tiene su negocio de pulperia desde hace 05 años donde vende productos relacionados con la canasta basica.
su casa la tiene desde hace 11 años que esta ubicada media cuadra al este de la iglesia remanente de Jesus en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
el credito le sera para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Santos M. A. is 46 years old and makes a living selling popular consumer products. Right now she does not have much merchandise in her store, and that is why she is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business. She had a problem before that cost her some money, but now she has recovered and needs a loan in order to purchase more merchandise and thus generate more profits. Maria has two children and has managed to support them by herself, since her husband is ill and does not work. Through her efforts Maria managed to build the small house where she lives with her family. She has had her small grocery store for 5 years and sells products relating to basic household needs. Her home, which she has had for 11 years now, is located near the Church of El Remanente de Jesus in the city of San Lorenzo. This loan will help Maria to get ahead with her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, beans, coffee, sugar, bread, powdered milk, candles, matches, soft drinks, and juices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lili Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Lili es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria (completa).

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, con el cual comprará redes y combustible para seguir realizando labores de pesca artesanal, producto que lo comercializa en las ferias de Capachica y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es poder culminar su casita.

A ella le  gustan las charlas y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lili is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” communal bank, located in the district of Capachica, Puno province, Puno Department. She is 34 years old and lives with her partner and two children. They live in the community of Capana. Lili completed primary education.

Lili has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was used as capital to build her fish selling business.

Currently, Lili needs a new loan for 500 soles, with which she will buy nets and fuel to continue in the field of small-scale fishing. She sells her products at markets in Capachica and Juliaca.

Lili’s greatest goal is to finish her house. She enjoys the talks and the savings at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets and fuel

loans.name: Alex Enrique

texts.es:
Alex tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío El Virrey, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis meses el se gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores (chivos, chanchos, ovejas) los cuales vende a los diversos negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Por otro lado brinda servicio de carga en una carreta artesanal que es jalada por un burro. Con estas actividades el apoya a la economía de su hogar.

Alex desea ampliar su negocio de venta de animales comprando más ejemplares para criarlos y engondarlos para luego venderlos. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es comprarse una mototaxi para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la zona. El es un joven trabajador y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Alex is 20 years old, single, and living with his parents in the hamlet of El Virrey, in the district of Olmos, located 2 hours and 45 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

For six months he has been earning a living raising and selling small livestock (goats, pigs, sheep) to various dealers in the area. He also transports cargo for people using a cart pulled by a donkey. With these businesses he is able to pay household expenses.

Alex wants to increase his animal selling business by buying more animals to raise and fatten to sell later. For this reason he decided to ask for 600 nuevos soles for his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

His dream is to buy a motorcycle taxi in order to offer services transporting cargo and passengers in the area. He is a young and very responsible worker.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying small livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es:
La  microempresaria Salvadora Natividad R. Sevilla tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos en edad de estudio, se dedica desde hace 19 años a trabajar como joyera realizando trabajos en oro y plata, es la única mujer en esta ciudad que realiza este tipo de actividad comercial. Entre los productos que confecciona tanto en oro como en plata están las cadenas, anillos,  normal de matrimonio y de promoción, aretes y pulseras.

Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos por parte de Kiva los cuales a pagado en tiempo y forma. Estos préstamos según doña Salvadora le han ayudado para tener mayor cantidad de materia prima y aprovecha a la vez este espacio para agradecer a los prestamistas y a Kiva por esa noble labor de ayudar a los más necesitados.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando para poder comprar más materiales para la elaboración de sus productos ya que en estos días existe demanda de anillos de graduación, por lo que solicita lo siguiente:

Para comprar: 45 gramos de oro, lo compra a US 10 dólares cada gramo, 30 gramos de plata la compra a US 0.80 dólares cada gramo, 2 libras de yeso a US 3 dólares cada libra y 12 piedras para anillo de graduación.
texts.en:
Salvadora Natividad R. Sevilla is a 46 year-old single mother with three school-age children. She has worked 19 years as a jeweler, making products in silver and gold. She is the only woman in her city to do this type of work. Among the products she makes in silver and gold are chains, rings (including wedding and class rings), earrings, and bracelets. This small businesswoman has been the beneficiary of two Kiva loans, which she repaid in a timely and efficient manner. According to Mrs. Salvadora, these loans allowed her to increase the amount of primary materials necessary to make her jewelry. She would also like to use this space to thank various lenders and Kiva for the noble task of helping the most needy. Currently, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more materials to make her products. These days there is a high demand for class rings, so she is asking for assistance in buying the following: 45 grams of gold (sold at $10/gram), 30 grams of silver (sold at $0.8/gram), 2 pounds of plaster (sold at $3/pound), and 12 stones for the class rings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying gold, silver, plaster, and stones for class rings

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia INES pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujeres.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ines belongs to the community bank "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Forward"). She is a native of Cusco. Ines is a 43 year-old married mother of four. She has two sons and two daughters. She alternates between household activities and working in her small business selling fruits. She sells regular and wholesale in the "Virgen Asunta" market in Cusco. Ines is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her fruit business. Ines is grateful for the opportunity allowed through this medium. She promises to complete repayments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL MUJERES 
EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS

Mujeres emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas se formo en el año 1995, aun permanece porque las socios son solidarias, responsables, puntuales además D. ser buenos amigos.
El mercado donD. tienen su negocio los socios,  cumple 23 años,  el mismo tiempo que ellos venden ahí. Reyna A. tiene un puesto D. venta D. ropa, ella empezó ambulatoriamente hasta que pudo comprarse un puesto en el mercado, donD. pueD. exhibir sus prendas. En la sección D. carnes venden Delia I. y Natividad V. donD. ofrecen  carne nacional e importada que lo traen D. un camal del mismo distrito.
Luis Auqui se dedica a la venta D. aves. Nuestras socias Lili A. y Lucila B.  se dedican a la venta D. calzado en el centro D. lima, nos comentan que tienen mucha competencia pero aun así pueden vender sus productos. Los demás socios tienen otros negocios tales como: venta D. verduras, mueblería, fotocopiadora.
Ellos solicitan el crédito para seguir mejorando sus negocios y tener mejores ingresos. Todos tienen un objetivo, ver a sus familias con una mejor condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Enterprising Women of the Micaela Bastidas Communal Bank Enterprising Women of Micaela Bastidas formed in 1995. It still exists because the members are very supportive, responsible, and punctual. They are also good friends. The market where the members have their businesses is 23 years old, the same amount of time they have sold there. Reyna A. has a stand selling clothes. She started as a street vendor until she could buy a stand to exhibit her clothes in the market. Delia I. and Natividad V. sell in the meat section. They offer national and imported meat, which they bring from a slaughterhouse in the same district. Luis Auqui sells birds. Lili A. and Lucila B. sell footwear in the center of Lima. They tell us that they have a lot of competition. Even so, they are able to sell their products. The rest of the members have other businesses like selling vegetables, furniture shop, and a photocopier. They are asking for the loan to keep improving their businesses and to have better incomes. All of them have one objective, to see their families with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of products

loans.name: Brigida Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación secundaria completa.

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado, la señora al mismo tiempo realiza trabajos en artesanía a crochet.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro para hacer más fácil si negocio de la pesca.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades y los prestamos.
texts.en:
Brígida is a member of the Juchuy Niño Communal Bank in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 27, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She lives in the Capana community. She has a high school education. This is her first loan. She needs a loan for 500 PEN to increase the capital in her business, selling fish. She also makes crocheted handicrafts. Her biggest wish is to buy a car to make her fish business easier. She likes the simplicity and the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Capana, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. pescado.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes y corchos para sus labores D. pesca, además arreglar su bote.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casita en Juliaca.

A ella le  gustan las reuniones donD. pueD. compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the Juchuy Niño Communal Bank in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 53, in a common law marriage, and has six children. She lives in the Capana community. She attended elementary school, but she did not finish. She has been working with the Movimineto Manuela Ramos for ten years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her fish selling business. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN, which will allow her to buy nets and floats for her fishing work. She will also fix her boat. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy herself a small house in Juliaca. She likes the meetings where she can share with her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nets and floats for fishing and fix her boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying piñatas

loans.name: Belky Yolani

texts.es:
la señorita Belky Yolani F. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en la aldea Rio Grande de la ciudad de Nacaome, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su otra hermana,  alquila un local en el interior del mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome Valle desde hace tres años en el cual vende productos 
alimenticios y de la canasta basica, esta actividad le a ayudado a generar sus propios ingresos y se ha ocupado de los gastos de su colegio, su deseo es continuar sus estudios en la universidad, esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio y con ello tener un poco mas de ganancias las cuales las necesita para ayudarle a sus padres con gastos del hogar y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Belky Yolani F. is 24 years old and lives in the Rio Grande neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She lives in her parents’ home along with her sister. For three years she has rented a stand inside the Nacaome city market where she sells foodstuffs and basic household goods. This activity has helped her to generate her own income and pay for school; her wish is to continue her studies at the university. She is asking for a loan in order to restock her business and thus generate more profits, which she needs so that she can help her parents with the household expenses and also pay for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing lard, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, salt, soups, oil, margarine, canned chili, and soap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arturo Ramon

texts.es:
En la foto puedes ver  a la señora G., esposa del cliente. Ella tiene 50 años y vive en Paraiso de la flor, una zona marginal de guayaquil. Cuenta con un negocio que brinda lavanderia, planchado y tintoreria de ropa con un horario de 8 de la mañana a 7 de la noche pero una de sus tres lavadoras esta dañada con este prestamo espera poder adquirir una nueva maquina cuyo precio es de $ 550,00. Ella cobra 0,90 por cada 12 piezas y asi atender a sus  clientes fijos que van desde 15 a 20 diarios desde hace 5 años.
En el futuro su meta es comprarse un taxi y retirarse del negocio.
texts.en:
In the photo you can see Mrs. G., the wife of the client. She is 50 years old and lives in Paraiso de la flor, a zone on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has a business that offers washing, ironing and dry-cleaning of clothes. She works from 8 in the morning to 7 at night but one of her three washing machines is broken. With this loan she hopes to get a new machine which costs $550. She charges $.90 for every 12 pieces of clothing and attends to her permanent customers who have been coming to her every 15 or 20 days for the past 5 years. In the future her goal is to buy a taxi and retire from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a washing machine

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia ASUNTA pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural D. la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos varones.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo D. atender su pequeño negocio D. venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. venta D. frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the communal bank "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" and is from the city of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and is married with four sons.

She mixes her housework with her work attending to a small business that sells fruits wholesale and individually in the market "Virgen Asunta" in the city of Cusco.

She requests a loan to increase the capital of her fruit selling business.

She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this loan and she promises to comply with the repayment time line.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the capital of her fruit selling business

loans.name: Marvin  Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marvin P., es trabajador activo es guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada, en estos últimos años ha trabajado  en la agricultura, de albañil. El cual le generaba buenos ingresos pero solo por contratos y luego hacia lo que saliera para poder dar el sustento a su familia es por eso opto por un trabajo fijo, son dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad el cual quiere dar una buena educación. Tiene 34 años de edad y espera poder hacer una casa buena para su familia y más segura ya que es forrada de zinc y es de suelo el piso. Contento por tener su casa propia pero desea mejorar es por eso con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, y hierro para comenzar a construir su casa de concreto, con el crédito anterior pudo hacer un cuarto de madera, con este quiere comenzar un arranque de piedra a largo plazo pero quiere una vivienda digna para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin P. works as a security guard at a private business. Before this he worked as a farmer and a builder. These jobs generated good income but they were only contract jobs and afterward he would have to leave to be able to support his family. He chose to get a permanent job so he could give a good education to his two children, who are 2 and 10 years old. Marvin is 34 years old and he hopes to be able to make a good house for his family that is more secure than their house that is lined with zinc and has a dirt floor. He is happy to have his own house but he wants to make it better. He wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to begin to build a house of concrete. With the last loan he was able to build a room of wood. In the long term he wants to begin a stone removal project, but in the meantime he wants his children to live in a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, cement and sand to begin to build a house of concrete

loans.name: Rosa Evila

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de tres hijos y dos de ellos son mayores de edad. Rosa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es estibador de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caribeñas” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo de 300 soles, lo utilizó para comprar blondas, telas, hilos de remalladora, elásticos. Ahora requiere un crédito de 1200 soles, monto que utilizará para reparar una máquina de coser y así poder continuar trabajando eficientemente. La meta de rosa es apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y poner una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is a hard-working, dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has three children, two of whom are adults. She manufactures clothing in a small workshop she has in her home. Her husband, who is a lumber stevedore, supports her work. She has been a member of the “Las Caribeñas” communal bank for the past three years. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy lace trim, fabric, seam finisher thread, elastics. Now she needs a 1200 sol loan which will be used to repair her sewing machine so that she can continue to work efficiently. Rosa's goal is to pay for her children's higher education and to set up a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 58 años de edad, es separado y vive junto a un hermano que tienes necesidades especiales en el caserío El Morante, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 40 años se dedica a la críanza de animales menores (ovejas, cerdos y chivos) los cuales ofrece en venta a los compradores que lo visitan en su caserío. Esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que Manuel afronta los gastos económicos familiares y apoya a su hermano.

El ha pensado en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más ovejas para criarlas y venderlas, ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio para su pastoreo. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es tener un establo implementado para la crianza de ganado vacuno. El es una persona muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran un hombre honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, is separated and lives with a brother, who has special needs, in the El Morante farmstead, Olmos district, located three and half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 40 years he has raised small animals (sheep, pigs, goats) which he then offers for sale to buyers who visit his farm. This is the only source of income with which Manuel meets his family's expenses and suppots his brother. He has thought of expanding his business by purchasing more sheep to raise and sell since he has enough space por pasture. For this reason, he is asking for his first, 1,000 sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest desire is to have an equipped cowshed to raise cattle. He is well-known and liked by his neighbors who consider him to be an honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rivas Cusihuallpa

texts.es:
La socia G. pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
G., 46, is a member of the "SIEMPRE ADELANTE" communal bank; she is from the city of Cusco. She is married and has three children: two girls and one boy. She alternates her domestic chores with tending to her small, wholesale and retail, fruit selling business which she has in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs financing to increase working capital in her fruit vending business. She is grateful for the opportunity given by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in her fruit vending business.

loans.name: Martha Genara

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Martha Genara F. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada con 9 hijos, entre adultos y menores de edad, todos conviven con ella y algunos se encuentran estudiando, esta microempresaria tiene 10 años de administrar un negocio de venta de ropas tanto de varones como de mujeres y niños.

Este negocio le ha permitido poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que todos dependen del mismo, incluyendo su marido que también trabaja en dicho negocio. La señora Martha F. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo de parte de Kiva, el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Ella señala que este préstamo le ayudo mucho en crecer un poco en su inventario y actualmente esta solicitando para comprar mas mercaderías ya que se acerca la navidad y es donde se aprovecha para este tipo de negocios.

Por lo tanto solicita se le preste para comprar los siguientes productos:


2 Docenas de Pantalones que compra cada docena a US 72 dólares, 1 docena de camisetas a US 60 dólares la docena, 2 docenas de  shorts a US 60 dólares cada docena, 1 docena de faldas blue jeans a US 96 cada docena, 1 docena de camisas a US 75 cada docena y 1 docena de  vestidos de mujer a US 165 la docena.
texts.en:
Martha Genara F., 46, is married and the mother of 9 children, some adult and some minors still, all of whom live with her; some are students. She has run a mens', women's and childrens' clothing sales business for the past 10 years. This business has allowed her to get her family ahead since they all depend on it, including her husband who also works at it. Mrs. F. has already benefitted from a previous loan from Kiva which she repayed in a timely fashion. She indicates that the loan helped her very much to increase her stock and she is now requesting financing to buy merchandise since the Christmas season is approaching and this is when this type of business can really earn profits. She is asking for financing to buy the following items: two dozen pants which cost 72 US dollars per dozen, one dozen shirts at 60 dollars US each per dozen, 2 dozen shorts at 60 dollars US each per dozen, 1 dozen blue denim skirts at 96 dollars US each dozen, 1 dozen shirts at 75 dollars US each dozen and 1 dozen women's dresses at 165 dollars US each dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, undershirts, shorts, skirts, blue jeans, shirts, womens dresses.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria González, es una mujer esforzada, la vida le ha dado muchas experiencias buenas y malas, durante trece años se ha dedicado a vender fritanga, venta de tortilla, y una mini pulpería.  Con ayuda de su esposo, y préstamo ha logrado aumentar mas sus ventas de comida haciendo una variedad de carnes, tajadas, entre otros. Las tortillas con ayuda de su hija mayor la hacen en los tres tiempos del día ya que es  alimento de los Nicaragüenses, su hija  mayor es la que sale a vender las tortillas ambulante por diferentes barrios pues ya tiene su clientela, lo cual ella atiende el pequeño comedor que con financiamiento de Afodenic ha logrado invertir mas y poner mesas nuevas para mejor servicio y presentación del local. Su esposo es conductor y tiene un hijo que cursa la primaria el cual espera apoyar para que sea hombre de bien, reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo, con este préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles y maíz, carnes para tener inventario para preparar los alimentos y vender en casa. Contenta por que gracias a estos financiamientos ha logrado mejorar su negocio el cual también ha podido cubrir sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Maria González is a strong woman for whom life has had a lot of experiences, some good, some bad. For 13 years she has sold fried food and tortillas as well as running a small grocery store. With help from her husband and financing she was able to increase her prepared meal sales making a variety of sliced meats, among other items. With help from her eldest daughter they make tortillas three times a day since it is a staple of Nicaraguan cooking. Her eldest daughter goes out to sell the tortillas to various neighborhoods for she already has her regular customers while she, herself, sees to the small dining room that financing from Afodenic has allowed her to set up with new tables to better serve her customers as well as give the place a more pleasant appearance. Her husband is a public transport driver and she has a son who is in elementary school, whom she expects to support so that he becomes an upstanding citizen. She lives in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood. With this loan she will buy rice, sugar, beans, corn and meats in order to have stock ingredients to prepare the meals she sells at home. She is happy because, thanks to these loans, she has managed to improve her business which has produced enough for her to meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, meats for meal sales and tortilla sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en: Tafa F. is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Gagaifo Lefaga. She is married and has five adult children. Tafa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2009, Tafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jenny Giovanna

texts.es:
La socia JENNY pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JENNY, 26, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank; she is single and from the city of Cusco. She alternates her domestic chores with her work tending a small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales stand in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs the funds to increase her working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in fruit sales business

loans.name: Xiomara Isabel

texts.es: Xiomara started her clothing and cosmetics business six years ago in order to increase her household income. She is married and has three children, the older two are 21 and 17, and the youngest is eight. Because of her business she is able to support their educations. Her greatest dream is for her children to be able to continue with and complete their educations. Xiomara has a strong credit history with Fundación León 2000 and their financial support of her business has allowed her to improve her living conditions. Xiomara reports that the difficult economic situation challenges her business. She will use this loan to buy more clothing inventory.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna  es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 50 años, es madre de seis hijos y cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica al alquiler de moto taxis diariamente (tiene 3 motos).
También vende gaseosas y chupetes, su esposo es obrero y trabaja en un aserradero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace tres años.  El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en repuestos para su motocar, ahora ella requiere de un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá comprar nuevos repuestos para sus tres vehículos, ya que necesitan mantenimiento. La meta de Reyna es tener su bodega bien implementada y crecer en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Reyna, 50, is a dynamic, enterprising woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has six children, four of whom are adults. She rents mototaxis (she has 3 of them) by the day. She also sells soft-drinks and popsicles. Her husband is a laborer and works in a sawmill. She has been a member of the “María Montessori” communal bank for the past three years. The first, 300 sol loan, was used to get replacement parts for her verhicle. Now she needs 1000 soles to buy more replacement parts for her three vehicles because they need maintenance. Reyna's goal si to have a well-stocked store and to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for her three mototaxis.

loans.name: Glenda Esther

texts.es: Doña Glenda tiene siete años de vender, ropa, electrodomésticos, y los fines de semana vende sopa, vigoron entre otros para mejorar los ingresos. Tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto con sus dos hijos, mayores de edad que trabajan y ayudan a pagar los gastos básicos como agua, luz, y alimentos. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa, hacer otro cuarto para dar a sus hijos mayor comodidad ya que siempre la han apoyado. Cuando inicio lo hizo con la necesidad de poder apoyar  a su familia y salir adelante, el negocio de sus hijos es la compra y venta de ganado y le queda buenas ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito en la institución el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, planchas, licuadoras para entregar a sus clientes ya que le da al crédito y los electrodoméstico los vende solo por encargo ya que son más caros. Con esto espera aumentar las ventas, captar clientela y seguir mejorando su economía. Todo esto con ayuda de Afodenic gracias a la oportunidad del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Glenda, 47, has sold clothing and appliances for the past seven years; on weekends she sells soups, vigoron {chopped cabbage; chimichurri: tomatoes, onions, garlic and cilantro pickled in lime juice; boiled yucca and chicharrones (fried pork skins and/or fried pork meat)}, among other items to improve her earnings. She lives with her two adult sons who work and help with basic household expenses like food and utilities. Her plan is to continue to improve her house, to build another room so her sons can have more comfort since they have always helped her. When she began, it was because of the need to support her family and get ahead. Her sons' work consists in buying and selling cattle and it produces good profits. This is her second loan with the institution and she plans to buy clothing, irons, and blenders to deliver to her customers since she sells them on credit and the appliances she only sells on order since they are more expensive. With this she expects to increase sales, gather more customers and continue to improve her finances. All of this is thanks to Afodenic's help with the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing, an iron, to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Cristina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito de Azángaro de la Región Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y estudió hasta el 4to grado de primaria.
Sonia Cristina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y seis meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de quesos en la mina la rinconada, paralelamente se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de cordero.
En la actualidad requiere de un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 (nuevos soles), para incrementar su capital de trabajo en la compra de quesos de paria y carne de cordero, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, que será para el bienestar de su familia. 
Su  mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante y progresar.
Referente a Manuela Ramos, manifiesta que le gustan las charlas y orientaciones que le dan en la reunión.
texts.en:
Sonia Cristina, 40, is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” communal bank which is in the Azángaro district in Puno region. She lives with her life partner and has three children; she completed fourth grade. Sonia Cristina has been working with Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year and a half. Her initial, 500 new sol loan, allowed her to buy cheeses from Mina la Rinconada. She also merchandises lamb meat. Currently, she needs a 1000 new sol loan to buy "paria" (a semi-hard, cow's milk cheese) cheeses and lamb meat in order to generate more income which will be for her family's wellbeing. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get ahead and progress. With regards to Manuela Ramos, she tells us that she enjoys the talks and training they impart at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lamb meat and cheese.

loans.name: Antonia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Antonia S. Tiene 19 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 4 años  de elaborar   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chibatz, del Cantón Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonia S., 19, is married and is a weaver. Together with her husband, who is a weaver also, they have a workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres." She has worked as a weaver for the past 4 years. She lives in Paraje Chibatz, in the Poxlajuj territory, in the Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial situation is insufficient for her to be able to increase her working capital. For this reason she turned to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of using it to buy more merchandise to be able to increase sales hoping, too, to provide better living conditions for her family and to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (raw materials purchase)

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus seis hijos en el caserío El Morante, distrito de Olmos, tres horas y media al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuatro de sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la zona.

Desde hace más de 23 años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ovejas, los cuales ofrece en venta a los compradores que visitan su caserío con frecuencia. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta para sustentar los gastos de su hogar.

Pedro ha pensado en mejorar la alimentación de los cerdos que cría para lograr su venta con mayor rapidez. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados.

Su más grande sueño es hacer mejoras en su casa que está construida de material rústico y cambiar las calaminas que le sirven de sombra ya que están deterioradas. El es un padre ejemplar y responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro, 57, is a married head of household that lives with his wife and six children in the El Morante farmstead, Olmos district which is three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo. Four of his children are students in a local school. For more than 23 years he has raised pigs and sheep which he sells to buyers that visit his farm frequently. This activity produces his only source of income with which he meets household expenses. Pedro has thought to improve his pigs' nutrition so that he can sell them sooner. For this reason he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1,000 sol, loan which will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed. His greatest wish is to make improvements to his home which is built with rudimentary materials and to replace the metal sheets, that are used for shade, which are very deteriorated. He is an exemplary and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for pigs.

loans.name: Karin Johana

texts.es:
La socia KARIN pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 28 años de edad, es padre y madre para su hija de dos años .

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Karin is a member of the village bank "Siempre Adelante" which is based in the city of Cusco.

She is 28 years old and acts as mother and father to her two year old daughter.

She alternates her household duties with managing a small business selling fruits wholesale and individually in the market "Virgen Asunta" in the city of Cusco.

Karin needs the loan to increase her capital for her business selling fruit.

She is grateful for the opportunity offered and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for her business selling fruit

loans.name: Filitaa

texts.en: Filitaa F. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Gagaifo Lefaga. She is married and has three school-aged children. Filitaa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 750 WST a month. Filitaa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Filitaa is now requesting a new loan of 2,750 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Ivonne S. es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, mucha ropa de bebe,  lleva seis años vendiendo para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de luz, agua y gastos de colegio, tiene 29 años de edad, y vive en un barrio 380, en donde hay mucha delincuencia, es por eso sus planes es seguir mejorando su casa para tenerla segura. En los últimos meses las ventan han disminuido lo cual quiere comprar otros productos que le generen ingresos comprara con este préstamo cajas de manzanas y uvas para atraer la captación de clientes nuevos y poder mejorar sus ventas, con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su casa y da las gracias a la institución por apoyar a crecer en su negocio como los beneficios de tener una casa mejor y bonita.
texts.en:
Ivonne S. is married and has two beautiful children aged 8 and 9. She sells clothing and cosmetics, including a lot of baby clothing. She has had this business for six years to help her husband cover the lighting and water bills and school fees. She is 29 years old and lives in an area where there is a lot of crime so she plans to keep improving her home to keep it safe.

In recent months, sales have decreased, which is why she wants to use this loan to buy other products to increase her income including boxes of apples and grapes in order to attract new clients and better her sales. She used her earlier loans to improve her house and wants to thank the organization for supporting the growth of her business and allowing her the benefits of a better and more beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of apples and grapes to attract more clients and vary her merchandise

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia tiene 46 años D. edad,  es madre D. familia D. 04 hijos, D. estado civil casada a los 16 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa, vive en el  Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles aumentó a su capital y compró 01 ganado vacuno, negocio al que se dedica conjuntamente con su esposo en la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno desD. que se casó con él.

Decidió seguir incrementando más capital a su negocio razón por el cual solicitará un nuevo crédito D. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que comprará 02  ganados vacunos.

Su visión es comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Ilave.
texts.en:
Flavia, 46, finished elementary school, married at age 16, has 4 children, and lives in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is one of the founding members of the “Ciudad Nueva” (New City) communal bank. With her first, 300 new sol loan, she bought a head of cattle. She has worked alongsiD. her husband raising cattle since the day she married him. She wants to increase her investment in her business by buying two more head of cattle. For this, she requests a new loan of 3.000 new soles. Her vision for the future is to buy a house in the city of Llave.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Gregorio Marcelo

texts.es: El Señor Gregorio tiene 29 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposa  e hijos, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 29, is a married weaver. “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” (Manufacture of Typical Fashions for Women) has a two-loom workshop. He lives with his wife and children. He and his wife have two employees who are also weavers. He has worked for the past 8 years making typical garments in his home which is in the Tzansiguan homestead, V. village, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Demand from his customers has now increased but his economic situation prevents him from meeting the demand. For this reason he called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing with the intention of buying raw materials to increase sales hoping, as well, to help his family get ahead and have improved living conditions.
