Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Leta

texts.en: Leta P. lives in the town of Maagiagi. She is married and has six adult children. Leta owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. Leta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Leta is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Leaia

texts.en: Leaia T. is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Faleaseela. She is single and does not have any children. Leaia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Leaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Leaia is now requesting a new loan of 2,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Hilda Esperanza P., tiene una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace seis años, en donde vende una variedad de productos de granos básicos,  golosinas, frutas y productos de higiene personal, comenzó con dinero propio vendiendo ambulante en las ruta urbana de la capital,  atoles y golosinas, se le hacia difícil pero tenia que generar ingresos ya que solo su esposo no era suficiente por que son cuatro hijos que dar educación, alimentación como lo necesario de la vestimenta. Por gracias de Dios vendía todo. Y  recogiendo lo cual logro poner venta de golosina en su casa el cual logro poco a poco hacerla en una pequeña pulpería que gracias a los préstamo que hizo en Afodenic logro fortalecerla hasta ahora, tiene 35 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos cursan sus estudios y su esposo trabaja como conductor. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa. Con este préstamo surtirá de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones, golosinas, lácteos, entre otros que es el alimento de los Nicaragüenses. Lo cual espera obtener mejores ventas ya que en los últimos meses han estado bajas las venta lo cual, tiene perdida en vez de ganancia lo que le ha ayudado es que tiene dos cuarto alquilando y son ingresos fijos mensuales el cual puede cubrir para pagar luz, agua, entre otros gastos. Contenta con la institución por hacer posible las mejoras en su negocio como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Hilda Esperanza P., 35, has a small general store which she has managed for the past six years where she sells a variety of products like: basic grains, sweets, fruits, personal hygiene items. She began with her own savings as an itinerant saleswoman of atole (drink made of cornflour) and sweets in the capital's urban routes. It was difficult work but she had to generate income because her husband's earnings weren't sufficient to provide schooling, clothing and food for four children. Thanks to God, she would sell out of everything. In time, she was able to start to sell sweets from her home and little by little it grew into a small general store which, thanks to loans from Afodenic, she was able to strenghthen still more until today. Her four children are students and her husband is a driver. Her plan is to be able to continue to make improvements to her home. With this loan she will stock up on rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, sweets, dairy products, among other items, which are typical of Nicaraguan cuisine. She hopes to improve sales since they have been low these past few months which has led to net losses rather than profits. What has helped her to stay afloat is that she rents two rooms which produce a fixed monthly income with which she can pay basic utilities, among other expenses. She is happy with the institution for making it possible to improve both her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on rice, beans, sugar, oil, and sweets.

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria R. tiene 50 años de edad, se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos, lociones, perfumes, cremas, vestidos para niñas. para esta epoca que navideña desea comprar mercaderia al por mayor, Gloria vende su producto en diferentes empresas privadas y estatales, desde ahorita le estan pidiendo el producto ya que con los pagos que reciben las personas le pagan.
ahora le estan ofreciendo varios productos al por mayor y desea comprarlos ya que estos se venden rapido.
Gloria es una persona muy amable y simpatica.
su trabajo la hace sentirse muy feliz.
texts.en:
Gloria R., 50, is a merchant who sells shoes, lotions, perfumes, beauty creams, girls' dresses. For this Christmas season she wants to buy merchandise at wholesale. Gloria sells her products to employees at various private and state-run enterprises and they are already asking for product as of today since they pay her with their salaries when they get paid. She is currently being offered products at wholesale and she wants to buy them because they sell out quickly. Gloria is a very nice and agreeable person. Her work makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, perfumes, lotions, dresses, and beauty creams.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es: La señora Zaida J., tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación, ubicada en Villa Venezuela, una pequeña pulpería con ocho años en las ventas de granos básicos, frutas, verduras, el cual inicio con prestamos pequeños y a ido invirtiendo para vender mas productos, no tiene mantenedora en donde pueda vender carnes, pollo. Solo vende gaseosa, frescos en un pequeño termo que dio la pepsi en donde vende sus pequeños productos. Su casa es pequeña los cuarto no son de concreto y como no tiene otro espacio para poner la venta la tiene en la sala y no tiene privacidad. tiene dos hijos dos hijos los cuales estudian en el colegio del barrio y por la tarde le ayudan ya que es una de muchas mujeres esforzada para dar lo necesarios a sus hijos como madre soltera, con este préstamo comprara verduras, frutas, arroz, frijoles, aceite,  gaseosas, golosinas un poco mas para mejorar las ventas. Espera en corto tiempo poder hacer un pequeño aumento a su casa para poner más cerca de la calle la venta para mejor vista y poder vender más a si como poder tener mas espacio en su casa. Agradece Afodenic por los financiamientos ya que ha logrado salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos y ha podido sastifacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Zaida J. lives in Villa Venezuela. She has a small grocery store in her home and has sold basic grains, fruits, and vegetables there for the past eight years. She started her business with small loans and has continued to invest in her store in order to sell more products. She cannot sell meats because she doesn’t have a refrigerator in which to keep them; she only has a small cooler that Pepsi gave her, which allows her to sell soft drinks and other small products. Her house is small, the walls are not made of concrete, and she doesn’t have privacy, and because she doesn’t have additional space for storing her products she has to put them in the living room. Zaida has two children, both of whom go to school in the neighborhood and help her in the afternoon, since their mother is a very hardworking woman who, as a single mother, attends to all of their needs. She will use this loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, oil, soft drinks, and candies so that she can improve her sales a bit more. She hopes that before long she can build a small addition to her house that would be more visible from the street, since this would help her improve her sales and would also free up more space in her home. Zaida is grateful to Kiva partner Afodenic for the funding, since she has been able to satisfy her small children’s needs and has managed to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, beans, sugar, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es una madre de familia de 49 años, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno viven con ella. Desde hace 3 años que tiene esta peña pulpería, funcionando en si vivienda en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como son los granos básicos, ella atiende personalmente su negocio y siempre ha contado con el apoyo familiar. Juana tiene varios financiamientos y todos han sido destinados para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, azúcar, detergentes, café, aceite y un poco de juguetes para la temporada navideña. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica ya que en estos tiempos es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Juana is a 49-year-old mother of 2 children, neither of whom live with her. She has had a small grocery store in her home for 3 years, where she offers essential products such as basic grains. She attends to her business personally and has always had the support of her family. Juana has had several loans, and all of them have been used to improve her business. Currently she is requesting this loan for working capital, which will be used to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, coffee, oil, and some toys for the Christmas season. Her desire is to maintain this economic activity, since these are difficult times, due to a lot of competition.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La socia MARLENE pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo de 8 años.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARLENE, 27, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank. She is single, has a life partner and an 8-year-old son, and is from the city of Cusco. She alternates her household chores with tending to her small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales stall in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs financing to increase working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital in fruit sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pagnes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food products as well as beauty products

loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.es:
la sra. Vilma Leonor A. R. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad el cual es muy buena ya que las tortillas es un alimento que acompaña a todas las comidas (desayuno, almuerzo y cena).
las tortillas de Vilma son muy buenas y sabrosas, las vende en mercaditos, pulperias y tambien las reparte en diferentes colonias y caserios cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
ahorita necesita el credito para poder comprar mas harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos, para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas, su negocio ha crecido y ahora vende mas diariamente y no esta produciendo lo necesario para las ventas diarias,
Vilma se levanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la masa y luego salir a venderlas durante todo el dia.
necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma Leonor A. R., 38, makes and sells tortillas. She has done this for several years and it is a profitable business because tortillas are consumed with every meal (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Vilma's tortillas are good and delicious. She sells them in little markets, small grocery stores and also distributes them among various neighborhoods and homesteads near her home. She needs financing to buy more wheat flour, firewood, lime powder, water and matches to increase her tortilla production. Her business has been growing and her daily sales have increased and she is unable to produce enough to meet her daily demand. Vilma gets up every morning at 4am to prepare the dough and then spends the rest of the day out selling. She needs financing to get ahead with her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, firewood, lime powder, water and matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria S. a sus 45 años de edad, ha logrado poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijos como madre soltera, tiene dos trabajo y se ha podido ayudar, trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada hasta la tarde, y cuando llega a su casa hace fritanga y vende bastante chicharrones de soya el cual manda a los niños a vender ambulante al barrio, se venden a cinco Córdoba la bolsa, se vende mucho por su sabor y para mejorar el alimento del día. Inicio este pequeño negocio con dinero de su salario y ahora con financiamiento que Afodenic ha logrado aumentar las ventas de comida, compra más cantidad carne, verduras para hacer mas venta y poder sacar mejores ganancias. Con este financiamiento comprara laminas de zinc, perlines para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta viejo y se le pasa en el invierno cuando llueve. Es por eso ve la necesidad de hacer las mejoras, pero solo a través del préstamo ha logrado hacer su mejoras ya que con su salario y las ventas logras sastifacer las necesidades básica. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer  posible este cambio en su humilde casa, como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
At the age of 45, Gloria Maria S. has managed, as a single mother, to see her two sons succeed. She has two jobs: she works as a caretaker for a private company until the afternoon. When she gets home she prepares fried food and sells quite a bit of soy chicharrones (pork cracklings); she sends her children out to sell around the neighborhood. She sells them for 5 Córdoba a bag. Sales are brisk thanks to their good flavor and to improve daily nutrition. She started this small business with money from her salary and now, with financing from Afodenic, she has managed to increase her meal sales: she can buy larger quantities of meat and vegetables to produce more to sell and thereby earn better profits. With this loan she will buy zinc metal sheeting and structural metal bars to replace her house's roof which is very old and leaky during Winter rains. For this reason she needs to make improvements but this would only be possible with financing since her salary and profits from her sales barely suffice to meet basic household needs. She thanks the institution for making these changes to her humble abode, as well as in her personal life, possible .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheets and structural metal bars to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio JULIAN pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo varón y una hija mujer todavía ellos están el colegio estudiando.

El tiene un pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. El mercado “Virgen Asunta” tiene 3 años de fundación y la fruta lo trae de la ciudad de Quillabamba que esta a 12 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.    

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas como papayas, plátanos, naranjas mandarinas, mangos, piñas etc.    
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JULIAN, 55, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank. He is married, has a son and a daughter, who are students still, and is from the city of Cusco. He has a small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales business in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. The "Virgen Asunta" market has been in operation for 3 years and he brings the fruit from the city of Quillabamba, which is 12 hours away from the city of Cusco. He needs financing to increase working capital in his fruit sales business. He sells papaya, banana, mandarin orange, mango, pineapple, etc. He is grateful to the institution for the opportunity he has been given and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in his fruit sales business.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Cesar es conviviente, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en casa de sus suegros en caserío El Virrey, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años el se dedica a la crianza de ovejas en el caserío El Morante y todos los días, montado en su mulo, cuida a sus animales mientras pastan. Cesar vende sus animales a los compradores que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente que le provee de ingresos.

Hace poco empezó la construcción de su casa, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alterniva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de calaminas y adobes.

Juan es un joven responsable y trabajador. Su más grande sueño es terminar de construir su casa para darle un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar, 28, has a life partner and lives in his in-laws' home in the El Virrey farmstead, Olmos district, located two hours and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years he has raised sheep in the El Morante farmstead and every day, riding his mule, he cares for his animals while they are at pasture. Cesar sells his animals to buyers who frequent the area. This work is his sole source of income. A short while ago he began to build his house and he needs financing, for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, of 1000 soles to buy metal sheeting and adobe bricks. Juan is a responsible, hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to finish building his house to provide a secure dwelling for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and adobe to build housing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food and supplies to sell

loans.name: Tirsa Carolina

texts.es: Tirsa Carolina es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 14 años y otra niña de 9 añitos que estudia su 3er grado de primaria, esta solicitando su 2do credito para compra de productos para su pequeño negocio de comideria; Tirsa se caracteria por ser una pequeña emprendedora dedicada a su negocio de venta de comidas (fritanga) y refrescos todos los dias en su casa de habitacion, lo que le permite mantener clientela permanente y asi obtener sus ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar,  el cual pretende mejorar y reforzar con material prima y realizar su oferta para dia, ya que en la actualidad solo trabaja por la tarde y al ampliar el local y su oferta obtendra mayores ingresos que le permitira mejorar las condiciones de vida familia y acondicionaria mejor su negocio, lo que le facilitaria cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.
texts.en:
. Tirsa Carolina is single and the mother of two children: a 14-year-old son and a 9-year-old daugther, who is in the third grade. She is requesting her second loan to buy ingredients for her small, prepared meal business. Tirsa is notable as a small entrepreneur who is dedicated to her business consisting of daily fried food (fritanga) and soft-drink sales in her home. This allows her to have a stable customer base and to earn income to support her family. She hopes to improve and strengthen it with raw materials so that she can offer her food all day; currently she only works afternoons. She would also like to enlarge the space and better equip her place of business so that she can earn more and improve her family's living conditions, which will help her meet her credit obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy product.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cassava and yam tubers

loans.name: Rafaela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rafaela de los Ángeles tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que dio inicio a este negocio, de manera ambulante cuando ella empezó a vender fue por la razón de que era madre soltera y tenía que sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, por lo que fue así de que decidió tomar la iniciativa de empezar a vender una variedad de ropa. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para trabajar y tratar de tener una estabilidad económica. Sus deseos son que sus esfuerzos valgan la pena.
texts.en:
Rafaela de los Ángeles is 41 years old. Her work is clothing sales. It has been more than 5 years since she began this ambulatory business. She began to sell because she was as ingle mother and she had to support her two children. Because of this she decided to take the initiative to begin selling a variety of clothing. It is for this that she is asking for this loan in order to work and try to have economic stability. Her desires are for her efforts to be worth the trouble.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Serapia Micaela

texts.es: La señora  Serapia B.  tiene 38 años de edad, es Casada  habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio llevan 15 años de laborar en la artesanía  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente, por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra  no son suficientes para poder cubrir su necesidad, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Serapia B. Is 38 years old. She is married, and lives along with her husband and children. She and her husband do the same work. They have spent 15 years doing craftwork. Her home can be found in Caserío Tzansiguan in the town called Vásquez, in the Department and Municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient to be able to cover the necessities. For this reason she has approached the Association ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and in this way increase her sales. She also hopes to be able to carry her family forward such that they would have a better livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell food products

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
Dona Blanca Estela L. is 60 years old; she is not married, and she has two adult children who are independent of her.

Dona Blanca has a used clothing business which she started several years ago in order to have a way to support herself. There is a lot of competition in the clothing business and Dona Blanca reports it to be one of the challenges of her business.

Dona Blanca has a very good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000, This loan will go toward the purchase of more used clothing inventory. She says that it will help her business and also her clients.

Her hopes for the future include being able to maintain her business and dreams of success for her children.

loans.use: More capital for business.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Luisa A. R. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene una hija adolescente que le ayuda a la fabricacion de las torillas, tambien le ayuda a empacarlas y venderlas en diferntes lugares, Ana se levanta muy temprano para empezar a producir las tortillas, con su hija han logrado sacar adelante este negocio.
en el mes que viene tienen varios encargos de tortillas para eventos y fiestas es por eso que necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima y no quedarse corta con la produccion.
su sueño es ver graduarse a su hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Luisa A. R. is 36 years old. She works making and selling tortillas. She has an adolescent daughter who helps her make the tortillas, and also to package and sell them in various places. Ana gets up very early in the morning to begin making the tortillas, and with her daughter she has managed to succeed in her business. In the coming month, she has various orders for tortillas for events and parties, and because of this she needs the loan to buy more ingredients and to not fall short on her production. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Natalie Sheilah

texts.es:
La socia NATALIE pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo varón que estudia en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de ofrecer el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos móviles (celulares) dentro del mercado “Virgen Asunta” ella no tiene un puesto de trabajo se moviliza por todo el mercado ofreciendo llamadas. . 

La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar su negocio con nuevos equipos de celulares para ofrecer el servicio a más personas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner, Natalie, belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Adelante" and is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 26 years old and is a single mother with one son who studies in school. She alternates her household chores with her job of offering cell phone service inside the market "Virgen Asunta". She does not have a stand, but rather she moves around the market offering her phone call service. Our partner requires this loan to purchase more cell phones to offer the service to more people. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her through this medium, and likewise she is committed to fulfilling her payments corresponding to the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more cell phones for her business

loans.name: Lazaro Jesus

texts.es: Don Lázaro H. padre de familia de 6 hijos todos a su cargo, su esposa ama de casa. Su negocio es un taller de carpintería con treinta dos años de hacer modelos diferentes en mueble. Las dificultades es que abecés le cuesta conseguir la madera buena, y cuando la haya a un costo muy alto de precio lo cual solo puede comprar poco y terminar el trabajo encargado, tiene 49 años de edad,  su propósito para sus hijos es apoyarlos en sus estudios y en lo que este a su alcance, cuando comenzó la carpintería sus trabajos los hacia solo, ahora tiene dos trabajadores para terminar los muebles mas rápido, mas finos, ya que a través del tiempo ha logrado una buena clientela que lo recomienda y es el único en el sector del barrio  Laureles Sur, con ese negocio que es una gran ventaja. Con este financiamiento comparara madera variada para hacer sus muebles y aumentar la variedad de productos ya que ha estado en estos últimos meses solo con encargo y desea hacer, camas, ropero, mesas y exhibir para mejorar las ventas. Contento por los nueve ciclos de préstamo que Afodenic ha dado para mejorar su inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Lazaro H. is a family man with 6 children, and a wife who cares for their home. His business is a carpenter shop, in which he has made different types of furniture for 32 years. The most difficult part is that sometimes it is hard to obtain quality wood, and when he is able, he can only afford to buy a small amount to finish the job he is on, due to the high price. He is 49 years old, and his goal is to be able to support his children in their studies. When he began doing carpentry, he made the furniture by himself, but now he has two workers who help him finish the furniture more quickly and with a higher quality. Over time he has built up a good clientele that recommends him to others, and he is the only one in the sector of the neighborhood Laureles Sur with this business, which is a great advantage. With this loan he will purchase assorted types of wood to make his furniture and increase the variety of products. He would like to make beds, wardrobe closets, and tables, which he will exhibit in order to improve his sales. He is happy about the nine loan cycles that Afodenic has given him to increase investment in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted types of wood to make furniture

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es: Don Juan T. tiene 23 años de edad, es Casado Posee los Servicios de “Mecánica” cuenta con tres empleado, habita junto  a su Esposa, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 4  años de elaborar  en los servicios ya mencionados su  residencia  se encuentra en el Caserío Pajucbalicaj de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para poder comprar dicho Activo para movilizarse, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife. He owns a mechanics shop and has 3 employees. He has been doing this type of work for 4 years now. His residence is located in the farmhouse Pajucbalicaj in the village of Nimasac, which is in the department of Totonicapan in Guatemala. Due to the economic conditions in which he finds himself, he does not currently have enough money to purchase a vehicle to get around. For this reason, he turned to the association ASDIR to request a loan, and in this way he will be able to increase his sales, hoping also to help his family get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his services

loans.name: Lidia Ivett

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Lidia S. es propietaria de su negocio de venta de juguetes, ropa, joyas, entre otros productos ofreciendo una gran variedad a sus clientes que le visitan. Ella actualmente está vendiendo árboles navideños para esta época y anhela aumentar sus productos.

Ella adquiere su mercadería fuera de Nicaragua y con mucho sacrificio busca como mejorar las condiciones del negocio. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio por medio de la compra de todos los productos como juguetes, árboles de navidad, ropa, joyas, entre otros y de esta manera adquirir el dinero para suplir las necesidades que presenta su hogar.
texts.en:
Lidia S., in San Rafael del Sur, owns a business selling toys, clothing, and jewelry, among other products, offering a great variety to her customers who visit her. She is currently selling Christmas trees for the season and hopes to increase her products. She acquires her products outside of Nicaragua and, with much sacrifice, seeks ways to improve the condiditons of her business. The financing she is requesting to invest in the busines will be to buy products like: toys, Christmas trees, clothing, and jewelry, among others to earn funds to meet her household's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Leua

texts.en: Leua A. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Salamumu Tai. She is married and has five school-aged children. Leua owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. Leua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Leua is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will again be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items to sell

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Doña Juana T. tiene 31 años de edad, es casada de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Pantalones”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, de 2 maquinas llevan 6 años ya  laborar   su residencia que se encuentra en San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Juana T., 31, is married and is a tailor. “Confección de Pantalones” (Trouser Manufacturing). She lives with her husband who is also a tailor. They have a small, two-machine, workshop and have worked for the past 6 years in their home located in San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from their customers has increased but their financial situation is insufficient for her to increase her working capital. For this reason she has called upon Asociación ASDIR for financing to buy raw materials to allow her to increase her sales hoping, too, to get her family ahead as well as providing better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
la sra. Gumercinda C. tiene 66 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ahora que es una señora de edad es lo unico que puede hacer, antes trabajaba en varias actividades pero ahora no puede.
tiene la ayuda de su hija para la produccion de las tortillas. 
Gumercinda vende su producto en diferentes cafeterias y restaurantes de la ciudad capital, esto hace que ella tenga una buena demanda de su producto, tambien lo vende cerca de su casa de habitacion.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para fabricar las tortillas ya que sus clientes mas fuertes le estan haciendo pedidos mas grandes cada dia que pasa y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su sueño es poder remodelar su casa y dejarla como realmente ella quiere verla.
este credito mejorara las ganancias para ir ahorrando para realizar sus mejoras a la casa.
texts.en:
Gumercinda C., 66, makes and sells tortillas. Now that she is a senior citizen this is all she is still able to do. She used to be able to do various activities but now she is not able. Her daugher helps her make the tortillas. Gumercinda sells her product to various coffee shops and restaurants in the capital city. This causes her to have a good demand for her products. She also sells near her home. She now needs financing to buy materials needed to make tortillas since her main customers are placing larger orders every day and she can't meet their demands. Her dream is to be able to remodel her house leaving it the way she really wants to. This loan will improve her profits so that she can save a little to put towards her home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, firewood, lime powder, water, matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia LUCILA pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos varones que estudian en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atencion con del pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. La fruta lo trae de la ciudad de Quillabamba que esta a 12 horas de la ciudad del Cusco. El mercado “Virgen Asunta” tiene 3 años de fundación.    

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas como papayas, plátanos, naranjas mandarinas, mangos, piñas etc.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The partner LUCILA belongs to the community bank “Siempre Adelante” (“Always Forward”) and is a native of the city of Cusco. The partner is 47 years old and is a single mother. She has two male children who are studying in school. She mixes her housework with attending the small business of fruit sales for wholesale or retail in the market called Virgen Asunta in the city of Cusco. She brings the fruit from the city of Quillabamba, which is 12 hours from the city of Cusco. The market Virgen Asunta has being running for 3 years. This member needs the loan in order to augment working funds for selling fruits like papayas, bananas, mandarin oranges, mangos, pineapples, etc. The member is grateful for the opportunity that is offered in this manner, and also she has promised to complete her repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds for Fruit Sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salted fish

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Ancara, tiene educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 meses.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de carnes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar carne en las comunidades de Ilave para venderla allí mismo, esta actividad la desarrolla una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas ya que dice que en ellas aprende muchas cosas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elvira, 20, is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank which is located in Ancara, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is single and has one son. She lives in Ancara and has finished elementary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 8 months. Her initial, 500 new sol loan, was used to capitalize her meat selling business. Currently, she needs a new loan of 300 new soles to buy meat in Llave and sell it there; an activity she does once a week. Her greatest desire is to continue working. She likes the savings and the chats because she says she learns a lot of things that help her in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.en: Olga is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000 and this is her third Kiva loan. She has a popular food stand in the Subtiava Market in the city of León. She has a prime location, an excellent reputation and a very strong work ethic. Through the financing of Fundación León and Kiva, she has expanded her services to include a section for the sale of clothing. This loan will be used to support both her food stand and the new clothing venture. She will purchase firewood, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, and chicken as well as a variety of new clothing merchandise. Olga reports that business can be irregular.  One day she will sell out of all the food that she cooked, and another day business will be poor, and her food will not sell.  Olga continues to grow her business and dreams of one day having a beautiful store that sells new clothing.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
POR UNA VIDA DIGNA

Este grupo lo forman 10 personas las cuales son muy responsables y solidarias  comenzaron hace 6 años viendo L. necesidad D. invertir en algún negocio con el cual poder contribuir en sus hogares.
Tal es así que L. Sra. Benedicta S. se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. yogurt D. diferentes sabores según lo solicitado por sus clientes así como también néctares D. frutas,  tiene mucha demanda,  es por eso que el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar una conservadora. Todo esto le ha permitido apoyar  a su hijo en su empresa D. servicios y colocación D. personal; es una socia muy activa en el grupo y es por eso que L. nombraron presidenta.
Como tesorera Elsa Dávalos se preocupa el pago puntual D. las cuotas del grupo. ElL. como profesora D. danza pudo notar que el alquiler D. disfraces era rentable así que elL. misma comenzó a confeccionar y alquilar los disfraces  a sus alumnos y otras personas; este negocio le ha dado muchas satisfacciones.
Así como ellas, las socias tienen diferentes negocios a los que le  dedican mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo,  porque uno D. sus objetivos más importante  es brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus familias.
texts.en:
POR UNA VIDA DIGNA (FOR A DIGNIFIED LIFE) COMMUNAL BANK This group consists of ten, very responsible and cooperative, persons who, six years ago, saw the need to invest in some type of business in order to contribute to the support of their households. As examples we have Mrs. Benedicta S. who makes and sells variously flavored yoghurts according to her customers' wishes; she also sells various fruit nectars. She has a lot of demand so the funds she receives will be used to buy an ice chest. This has allowed her to support her son in his empolyment agency. She is a very active group member and, because of that, she was selected to be the group president. As group treasurer, Elsa Dávalos is concerned that the group makes punctual repayments. As a dance teacher, she noticed that renting costumes could be a profitable enterprise so she began to make them herself and then rent them to her students and others. This work has given her much satisfaction. Like them, the other group members have different lines of work to which they are dedicated with much enthusiasm and effort because one of their most important objectives is to proviD. their families with sustenance and good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: María Hermelinda

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene 44 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Consumo Diario”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella se dedica en la venta ,  llevan  4  años de vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xolcaja  del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María T., 44, is a married merchant. “Venta de Consumo Diario” (Sales of Everyday Consumables). She lives with her husband and she is in sales. They have been in sales for 4 years. They live in Paraje Zolcaja, Poxlajuj territory, department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her working capital to meet demand. For this reason, she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing to buy raw materials in order to increase sales, hoping thereby to see her family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don Manuel F. trabaja como electricista en la empresa de zona franca las mercedes, desde hace siete meses, el cual le costo entrar a la empresa por que casi no hay plaza en su ramo. Vive junto con su esposa y un hijo el cual estudia la secundaria. Su esposa trabaja en servicios domésticos para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar como el pago de agua, luz, entre otros. Sus planes para su hijo es poder dar una buena educación para que sea un hombre de bien. Con el crédito anterior logro terminar la construcción de un baño, pero por falta de dinero no logro terminarlo y ahora pondrá la cerámica y las puertas para una mejor higiene. Así como la construcción de un pequeño muro que comenzara hacer poco a poco para dar mejor seguridad a su pequeña casa. Es por eso que se esfuerzan los dos para poder terminar las mejoras de su casa pronto. Contento por el apoyo de Afodenic que gracias a sus préstamos a largo plazo ha podido hacer posible la construcción necesaria para su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel F. has been an electrician in a company located in the Las Mercedes free zone for the past seven months. It was very difficult to get this job because there are hardly any open positions in his specialty. He lives with his wife and son, who is a secondary school student. His wife works as a domestic to help defray houshold expenses like utilities, among others. His plans for his son is that he have a good education so that he can grow up to be an upstanding citizen. With his previous loan he managed to finish construction of a bathroom but he ran out of money before finishing it completely. He will now add the tile and doors for better hygiene. He will also work on a small exterior wall which he will begin to build bit by bit to provide better security for his small home. This is why they both work so hard: to be able to finish the home improvements soon. He is happy with the help from Afodenic whose long-term loans have made possible the necessary construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ceramic tile and doors to complete bathroom for better hygiene.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
La venta de repuestos para bicicletas es la actividad a la que se dedica el señor José Ernesto G. en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur desde hace cuatro años. Ha adquirido mucha habilidad en la reparación de bicicletas y por esto es muy visitado por los clientes tanto para reparar sus bicicletas como para comprar los repuestos.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de los repuestos y  accesorios para las bicicletas para así comercializarlas y cuando un cliente le compre tales repuestos lograr instalarlo en dicha bicicleta. Es por este motivo que espera en que el crédito le será otorgado y así logrará continuar desempeñándose en su actividad.
texts.en:
José Ernesto G. has sold bicycle replacement parts in the town of San Rafael del Sur for the past four years. He has learned much about bicycle repairs and this is why he is visited by many customers both to have their bicycles repaired and to buy replacement parts. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy replacement parts and accessorieis for bicycles to sell and, when a customer buys said parts, to install them on their bicycles. For this reason he hopes that the loan will be approved so that he can continue to develop in his chosen line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle replacement parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Micaela Isabel

texts.es: Doña Micaela tiene 51 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella se dedica en la venta de ropa Típica, llevan  8  años de vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  la Planta  del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
“Venta de Cortes Típicos” (Typical Garment Sales) Micaela, 51, is a single merchant. She lives with her parents and, for the past 8 years, has sold typical clothing. She lives in Paraje la Planta, Poxlajuj territory, Totonicapán department and municipality, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial state is insufficient for her to increase capital to meet demand. For this reason she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan which will be used to buy raw materials to increase sales hoping, as well, to see her family get ahead and have improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.en: Jose is married and has two children ages 7 and 11. They are both in primary school. For 23 years, Jose has been a carpenter. He trained in a technical school and now has his own workshop. Through past loans, Jose has been able to improve his workshop and to acquire more tools. This loan will go towards the purchase of materials to build cabinets. Jose dreams of continuing to strengthen his credit history so that he can afford a new sander. He reports that the economic decline has affected the demand for his products. He also worries about his health, because he doesn’t want to miss work.

loans.use: To buy materials to build cabinets

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en: Solinuu F. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Solosolo. She is married and has three school-aged children. Solinuu owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She earns approximately 300 WST a month . In 2009, Solinuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en:
Nuufou I. is a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Laulii Maagila.  She is married and has 5 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Nuufou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members.  

In 2009, Nuufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nuufou is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Nuufou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.en: For 13 years, Alba has had her pulpería, a small general store. Her pulpería stocks and sells essential daily items. Before opening her store, Alba was a teacher but her classes were far from her house and she was not able to care for her family. Since opening her store, Alba has been able to better support her family and provide for the education of her children. She has three children between the ages of 25 and 20. The oldest child is married and the younger two are studying at the university. Alba dreams that her two children at the university are able to continue their studies and become professionals. One wants to be an engineer. This loan will go towards the purchase of staple items for her store’s inventory, like rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and coffee. There is a great deal of competition for a pulpería. There is one found on nearly every street. Alba maintains close relationships with her customers in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 64 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposa, su madre y un nieto en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace más de 17 años. Empezó fabricando ataúdes en el taller de un amigo de su padre, poco a poco conoció mas de este oficio y empezó a trabajar en sus propios pedidos. Actualmente fabrica camas, roperos y puertas para luego venderlas en la ciudad de Trujillo y en Casagrande.

Sus trabajos son bastante solicitados debido a la calidad y responsabilidad con que los elabora. El está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más madera y de una sierra circular.

El es un padre honrado, responsable y muy trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es seguir equipando su taller para seguir sacando adelante a los suyos y brindarle las calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
. Eugenio, 64, has 4 children and lives with his wife, her mother and a grandson in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a carpenter for the past 17 years. He began building coffins in the shop of a friend of his father's. Little by little he learned more carpentry skills and began to work on his own orders. Currently, he makes beds, wardrobes and doors for sale in the city of Trujillo and in Casagrande. His items are quite popular due to their quality and workmanship. He is asking for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa: 1,000 new soles to buy more lumber and a circular saw. He is an honest, responsible and very hard-working father. His greatest desire is to continue to equip his workshop so that he can continue to see his loved ones get ahead and offer them the quality of life they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and a circular saw.

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.en:
Josefa inherited her business and now sells red meat and pork in the Subtiava market in the city of León.

She has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and because of these loans, has built up her business. As a result, the Subtiava market has given Josefa a prime location.

Josefa is married and has a 17 year old son who is in high school. Josefa is determined to continue with her business in order to support her son so that he can become a contributing member of the community.

loans.use: Capital for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions, local food and beverages.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
CELESTINA G.
El resultado de todo su esfuerzo es el pequeño restaurant (pancita, anticucho, rachi y pollo a la parrilla) que tiene la Sra. Celestina G., lo construyo hace 30 años juntamente con su esposo.
Empezó este negocio como ambulante en la calle con un pequeño mostrador y una parrilla de mesa, tiempo después la municipalidad no le permitía este tipo de venta ambulatoria fue entonces que la Sra. tuvo que alquilar un local, eso fue favorable para ella ya que tenía muchos clientes y necesitaba espacio para atenderlos con más comodidad, solo contaba con algunas mesas y sillas que pudo adquirir, y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar  artefactos, una parrilla a carbón mas grande, y algunos estantes que le hacían falta.
La Sra Celestina se levanta muy temprano para comprar los insumos que necesita ya que para ella es muy importante la calidad de su comida, sabe que tiene mucha competencia, es por eso  que ella misma prepara y supervisa la atención a sus clientes, además siempre tuvo la ayuda de sus 4 hijos y gracias al trabajo en equipo 3 de ellos son profesionales.
Ella se siente muy contenta ya que mediante su negocio pudo ayudar a sus hermanos que ahora son negociantes en diferentes rubros, apoya a sus padres con sus necesidades básicas, además de aportar en casa. Tiene una sobrina que trabaja con ella así puede ayudarla económicamente.
 El préstamo recibido será destinado para la compra de insumos y renovar algunos mostradores que tiene en su negocio.
texts.en:
Celestina G. The result of all of her effort is a small restaurant (tripe, kebobs, grilled beef tripe, and chicken on the grill) that Celestina G. has. She and her husband built it 30 years ago. She started this business selling on the street with a small counter and a table grill. After a while, the municipality did not permit this type of selling on the street. So, she had to rent a place. This was favorable for her because she had many customers, and she needed space to take care of them more comfortably. There were only a few tables and chairs that she could get. With great effort she was able to buy fixtures, a much larger charcoal grill, and some shelves that she needed. Celestina gets up very early to buy the supplies she needs because the quality of her food is very important to her. She knows that she has a lot of competition. That is why she herself prepares the food and supervises waiting on the customers. Also, she has always had help from her four children. Thanks to working as a team, three of them are professionals. She is very happy that through this business she could help her siblings. They are now merchants in different fields. She helps her parents with their basic necessities as well as contributing at home. She has a niece who works with her. That way she can help her economically. The loan is to buy supplies and renovate some of the counters that she has in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.en: Claudia is 30 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 9. She has had her clothing sale business for two years. She sells women’s clothing, such as blouses, shoes, and dresses, as well as perfumes. The business arose from the need to increase her family’s income because her husband could not support the family with what he was earning. This loan will go towards the purchase of more clothing inventory. Claudia’s daughter is frequently ill, challenging both the family and Claudia’s business. Her dream is for her family's well being. Claudia wants to see them continue to do well and stay together through the difficulties that life brings.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Leticia M.

texts.en:
Leticia is a married woman who has been in business for about 18 months. She has a daughter in nursery school and eight dependents. Leticia owns a kiosk at the central market in Bo where she sells cosmetics and African dresses for women. Prior to setting up her own business, Leticia was in hotel management, but then resigned as the salary she was earning was meager. 

Leticia hopes to use the loan to purchase additional cosmetics and African dresses for her kiosk, and the proceeds will be used partly to secure a plot of land and later build a house. She spends her entire time at her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and dresses.

loans.name: Mario Waldemar

texts.es: Don Mario V. tiene 21 años de edad, es casado de oficios Artesano,  “Elaboración de calzado”, habita junto  con su esposa, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan 4 años de laborar  su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Xetinimit de la  Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Craftsmanship - Shoemaking Mario V., 21, is a married craftsman. He lives with his wife who does the same kind of work as he. They have a workshop and have worked for the past 4 years. They live in Xetinimit homestead, Nimasac village, Totonicapán department, Guatemala, Currently, demand for their products has increased but their economic capabilities are insufficient to meet demand. For this reason, he has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan which will be used to buy prime materials in order to increase sales hoping thereby to see his family get ahead and have imporoved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Osiris Mileyda

texts.es: Osiris Mileyda tiene 32 años, es madre soltera. Rosa tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de muy pocos productos, debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar, por lo que salía a recorrer las calles ofreciendo los dulces, lamentablemente algunas veces no lograba vender mucho, pero no se dio por vencida y además de salir a vender por las calles también ofrecía sus productos a sus vecinos. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bombones, paletas, chicles, caramelos y chocolates  y así generar un poco de ingresos. Osiris tiene le deseo de establecer la venta de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Osiris Mileyda, 32, is a single mother of four, school age, children. She has sold sweets and has been involved in this humble activity for the past 9 years. She had many difficulties and decided to try to see her children get ahead so she decided to buy a very limited number of products because her income was not sufficient to sustain her home. She would go out into the streets offering her sweets. Regretably, sometimes she managed to sell very little but she did not let this defeat her. Besides selling in the streets she also offered her products to her neighbors. For this reason, she is requesting financing to buy candies, lollipops, chewing gum, caramels, chocolates to generate income. Osiris wishes to set up clothing sales in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ofelia Marina

texts.es: La Señora tiene 39 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana,  “Confección de delantales”, habita junto  con sus hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un Taller del mismo oficio, llevan  16 años de laborar su residencia  se encuentra en el  Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Handicrafts. Apron Manufacturing. The lady is a 39-year-old, married woman. She lives with her children. Her children and she share the same occupation. They have a workshop and have been working for 16 years. They live in Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán department, Guatemala, Currently, demand from their customers has increased but their economic situation has precluded their being able to invest capital to meet demand. For this reason she has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing which will be used to buy raw materials to increase sales hoping, too, to help her family get ahead and have improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Gynthia Marisol

texts.es:
Cynthia es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace año y medio tiene una bodega – tienda en su casa en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y útiles de oficina. Su negocio es el único de su tipo que existe por la zona por lo que sus clientes siempre acuden a el. Cynthia nos comenta que la idea de su negocio nació ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hogar, su esposo trabaja como soldador en la ciudad de Trujillo y entre los ingresos que ambos perciben sustentan a su familia.

Debido a la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas Cynthia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de panetones y champagne para ofrecérselos a sus clientes. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa para ofrecerle un techo seguro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cynthia, 23, is a married mother of two sons, 7- and 2-years-old, who lives with her husband in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year and a half she has run a general store from her home where she offers everyday articles, groceries, sweets, and office supplies. Her business is the only one of its kind in her area so her customers always come to her. Cynthia mentions to us that the idea for her business grew out of the need to meet her household expenses. Her husband is a welder in the city of Trujillo and with the earnings they both make they are able to support their family. Due to the nearness of the Christmas holidays, Cynthia wants to expand her offerings to include panetones (an Italian sweet bread that is a Christmastime staple) and champagne to offer her customers. For this reason, she is requesting financing, in the amount of 1,000 new soles, from Edpyme Alternativa. She has worked with our institution in the past and demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with respect to repayments. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house so that she can offer her children a secure home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panetones and champagne to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
Bordar ropa de fiesta, especialmente de la danza de Moreno es la actividad principal de Maruja M. , quien emprendió su negocio con su esposo hace 10 años, también con el adiestramiento de su suegro, desde entonces con los ingresos generados sostienen a su familia, ella vende sus productos todos los días en diferentes ferias. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales. 
Las demás integrantes  del grupo Kantutas, también cuentan con diversos negocios como la venta de chamarras, deportivos, tejido de chompas, venta de carne, artefactos y alimento seco, necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, materia prima e insumos.
texts.en:
Maruja M. embroiders festive clothing, especially "Moreno" dance clothing. It's a business that she began with her husband 10 years ago, with the help of her father in law. They sell their products each day in different markets. They began this business to bring in more money to sustain their family. Now, they are requesting a loan to purchase materials needed for their business. The other Kantuta members also have their individual businesses where they sell jackets, sportswear, hand knitted sweaters, meats, dry food products and artifacts. They, too, are requesting loans in order to purchase merchandise, top quality materials and inventory for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, MATERIA PRIMA E INSUMOS (to purchase merchandise, top quality materials and inventory for their businesses)

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es: Laura Maria M. L., ella tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta productos lácteos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo bolsas de leche y fue a partir de ese momento que fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo más grande, y poder vivir de ese negocio, ya que los trabajos están escasos en nuestro país. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de más productos. El sueño es que su negocio crezca y si Dios lo permite, convertirse en una distribuidora de productos al por mayor de sus productos.
texts.en:
Laura Maria M. L. is 45 years old and has 4 children who all work independently. She has been selling dairy products for more than 4 years. Laura started her business selling bags of milk, and from that point, she kept reinvesting so that she could make it bigger. This became her means of earning a living since jobs are scarce throughout the country. Her loan will be used to buy more dairy products. She dreams of growing her business, and God willing, becoming a wholesale dairy distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more dairy products

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has five school-aged children. Sina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Sina is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina J. is from the city of Hinagdong Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling products such as junk food, sugar, candies, salt, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Sieng P. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She usually saves up many sets of baskets before selling. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weaves baskets too. Sieng P. is taking out her loan to buy a small neighboring plot of land in a good location for her to cultivate crops to raise income.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land to cultivate crops.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín.
