loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer B., 38, maintains her belief that “the best way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.” She loves to cook for her family, especially for her husband Jonjie, 39, who works as a driver and also a cook. They have 4 lovely children – all school-aged; two are in high school and the other two in grade school.

She has been in business for ten years. A small portion of their house serves as her food stall where she cooks and sells “value meals” which are a hit for drivers and students. She makes a monthly income of PHP 29,000. Her children take turns assisting her in her business, especially on peak days and when there are no classes.

Jennifer got more blessings when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She used her previous loans from the cooperative to sustain her business. Now on her 9th loan cycle, she needs a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital on her newest business venture - buying and selling hog meat.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Buy and sell hog meat and raw materials for food stall

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
“Patience and sacrifices are the major steps towards success” says Mrs. Ofelia C. of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya.

She is married to Mr. Felix C. and they are gifted with three children. Being industrious parents, two of their children graduated from college and presently applying for a job. The youngest is still studying in tertiary education.

The main source of their living is through farming. They till their land twice a year by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Ofelia engages in selling vegetables in their village and also at Solano Public Market during market days. She wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to Php 13,000 to be used to acquire more vegetables to be sold in their village.

She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional capital to help in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie sells fruits, vegetables and fish. She is 30 years old and presently living with her husband and three children in the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. Her three children are currently enrolled in high school. Her net daily income is 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) and she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from lenders for additional working capital for her business. She works hard to improve the general living conditions of her family. She's hoping earnestly that Kiva lenders will fund her requested loan so she may have a fruitful life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Catherine Namisango‘S Group

texts.en:
Catherine wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of secondhand clothes. She works seven days a week in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She serves an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all kinds of people, both retail and wholesale. She incurs transport costs to buy charcoal from the Luwero District market (one of the central districts of Uganda). She uses public transport to get to and from Luwero. Her major business challenges include the ever increasing price of charcoal and transportation, and the rainy season which hinders her customers' ability to reach her. 
 
Catherine is a 45-year-old married woman with eight children between the ages of 3 and 25 years. Catherine also takes care of additional family members. Six of her children go to school. She owns a one-room house where she lives with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food for the family, and medication. 

Catherine has been in her business for ten years, and also with MCDT for ten years – now on her 20th loan. Catherine joined MCDT because it is near her home and is an easy MFI to work with. She hopes to see her business get bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way” – words of encouragement from hardworking mother, Jonelyn D. V., of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the loving wife of Mr. Marcos D. V. and they are gifted with three children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of their life, they have strong faith and determination to improve their standard of living through patience and hard work.

As a way of earning income, her husband works as a caretaker in Jacintas Hotel and Resort while Jonelyn has a business buying and selling vegetables in their village. She buys vegetables from farmers and sells them at Solano Public Market and also house to house in their village. Her monthly income is 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) which they use for their daily needs and for the schooling of their children. Due to the high cost of commodities, she needs to increase her income to meet their daily needs, but she has little capital. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to be used to improve her small business. She believes that with patience and sacrifice she can improve her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Alice owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.  About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin. She is 38 years old. Lilibeth is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living Lilibeth owns and operates a videoke business.

Lilibeth is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use as working capital to purchase additional inventory.

Lilibeth joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is a 59 year-old businesswoman who is married and blessed with five children. Her children are adult age already but she still supports some of them. Their family lives in the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela.

Evangeline operates a furniture business together with her husband. It has been their source of income and it helps a lot in providing for their family's needs.

Evangeline dreams of further expanding their business through obtaining more wood in order to produce more furniture and meet the demands of their customers.

She hopes to borrow a loan of 8000 PHP for the improvement of their furniture business. It will also be used to buy other materials needed and for the labor of some carpenters working in their manufacturing business.

loans.use: To improve their furniture business.

loans.name: Twekembe Kikooza Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
Sarah M. is representing her fellow women in her lending group to seek a loan from Pearl Microfinance. She is a married lady with no children of her own, but with so many to cater for, mostly her husband’s children and other relatives.

Sarah has a retail shop and a milk-selling business thanks to the loans that have helped her re-capitalize her two businesses, hence coping with paying school fees for her dependents.

She has benefited a lot through the loans she gets and with her last loan; she was able to start a dairy shop with some of the milk coming from her cows at home.

She has so much pride in her loans and she is requisitioning for another loan to help with restocking her shop with more products.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, and married with 10 school-aged children.

To make a living, Imelda runs a sari-sari (variety) shop. Her main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products to the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Seeta Development Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 43 years old and married with five children, the youngest being 12 years old.

Sarah has a stall in Seeta Trading Centre where she has sold fresh produce and chickens for seven years.

She is so hard working and she has been able to repay back her loan with a lot of ease yet it has worked for her. She is happy that she has been able to transform her business by having more stock - hence more profits.

Sarah needs a loan to help buy more fresh food and chicken for resale.

Sarah is a determined and hardworking lady that has been able to cater for her family with the help of her husband.

loans.use: To buy fresh food and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza G.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling green bananas in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. Liza has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elidio Dias

texts.pt:
Elidio Dias P. nasceu na cidade de Chimoio, capital da Província de Manica, centro de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de um filho de 7 anos de idade. Fez 12ª classe, neste momento continua a fazer o ensino técnico profissional. Vive na casa própria com seus irmãos e sustenta também a sua filha que vive com a sua mãe.

Saiu de Chimoio para Maputo concretamente no Distrito de Boane, aos 14 anos de idade com os seus pais. Faz um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e recargas de telemóveis, com estes consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt e tem outro rendimento de 4.900.00mt provenientes do subsidio pago pela embaixada da Ruanda, onde lecciona a língua portuguesa das 17h as19h. Com estes rendimentos consegue poupar algum dinheiro na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 21.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (bolachas, açúcar, caldos, recargas e outros) para satisfazer a sua clientela. Os empréstimos passados foram de os mesmos foram para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, afim de ampliar o seu negócio e construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Elidio Dias P. was born in the city of Chimoio, capital of the Manica province in the center of Mozambique. He is 29 years old, single, and father of one child who is 7 years old. He completed 12th grade and is currently enrolled in technical college. He lives in his own home with his siblings and also supports his daughter who lives with her mother. He left Chimoio for Maputo, specifically for the Boane district, with his parents when he was 14 years old. He has his own business selling basic necessities and cell phone minutes. He earns around 11.000,00 MT from these activities and also earns 4.900,00 MT a subsidy paid by the Rwandan embassy, where he teaches a Portuguese language class form 5pm to 7pm. With his earnings he is able to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans in other banking institutions. He learned about Hluvuku through his brother who is also a client of the institution. This is his 4th loan, in the amount of 21.000,00 MT, which he will use to purchase products (biscuits, sugar, soups, batteries, etc.) to serve his customers. His prior loans were for the same amount and for the same activities. In the future he plans to request additional loans with the goal of growing his business and building a shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of food products and cell phone minutes

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 26 years old and married with one child, who is six years old and goes to school. Sophie resides in and owns a one-room house where she stays with four people. She also takes care of some additional family members. The family has access to electricity but not piped water. They get three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying her metal fabricators from Kisenyi Market, one of the one of the markets in Kampala City. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala and uses public transport to and from Kisenyi.

Sophie works seven days a week. She has an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of metal fabricators and transport and the rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and medication.

She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years. This is her seventeenth loan. Sophie joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more metal fabricators. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more metal fabricators.

loans.name: Constancia Simao

texts.pt:
Constância Simiao Muitu nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos de 15 e 21 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez o nível médio, neste momento esta a concorrer para a faculdade. Vive na casa própria com a família, o marido é professor, numa das escolas na cidade de Maputo e para alem da sua família sustenta mais 2 familiares enviando dinheiro.

Nunca mudou de residência, é professora permanente há mais de 9 anos, formada pelo Centro de Formação de Professores de Namaacha e pelo Instituto de Magistério Primário da Matola. Tem um salário mensal de cerca de 6.500.00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária após as despesas caseiras, o marido também ajuda através de seu salário.

Já teve empréstimos com uma instituição financeira denominada NOVO BANCO no valor de 20.000.00mt, o qual foi destinado para o início da sua obra de construção da sua casa. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas e amigos assim decidiu solicitar empréstimos, sendo este o seu 3º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo também afim de poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro e concluir a sua obra, para poder oferecer melhores condições de habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Constância Simiao Muitu was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is 40 years old and has two children, ages 15 and 21. The whole family attends school. Constância completed technical school and is about to apply to the university. She lives in her own home with her family. Her husband is a professor in one of the schools in the city of Maputo. Besides her family they also support two relatives by sending them money. She has never left Maputo and has been a full time professor for more than 9 years. She trained at the Center for Teacher Training of Namaacha and the Institute of Elementary Education in Matola. She earns a monthly salary around 6.500.00 MT and is able to save a bit in her bank account after paying the household expenses. Her husband also helps with his salary. Constância previously had loans with Novo Banco in the amount of 20.000.00 MT which were used to start construction on her home. She learned about Hluvuku through colleagues and friends and decided to take out a loan. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00 MT, which she plans to use to purchase materials (iron, cement, sand, etc.) to continue construction on her home. Her previous loans were for 10.000.00 MT and 18.000.00 MT, also for the same purpose. She promises to pay back this loan on time so that she will have access to future loans in order to finish her home and provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement blocks, cement, etc. )

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
“If others can, why can't I?” Some words of encouragement from Lovely D., a loving housewife of Leomar D.. They live in a village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya with their four children. Being parents, they want their children to finish their studies so that they will be employed someday. Despite our economic crisis, they still have the strong determination to uplift their status of living.

Farming is the common source of their income. They plant rice and some vegetables twice a year. Lovely is also engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in their village to help her husband earn income. She wants to acquire more vegetables to be sold at Solano Public market but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow P 7,000 to strengthen her capital and acquire more vegetables. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can improve her small business and increase her income for the sake of their survival and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William B. Sr. is a 61 year-old rice farmer. He plants rice because it is one of the major agricultural crops in his town in Agusan Del Sur. Rice is also a basic food for Filipinos. He is married and has eight children. His oldest child is 38 years old and is now married.

William needs additional capital for his farm. He sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. He requested to loan Php 12,000. This loan will help William in his farming and hopefully he will be able to double his harvest this time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his rice farm.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.pt:
Sandra Maria N. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 5 anos de idade. Fez 9ª classe parou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive com os seus filhos na casa dos pais, sustenta 3 irmãos que vivem com ela.

Saiu da Matola para Boane quando criança com os seus pais. Tem um negócio a mais de 3 anos, trabalha sozinhas das 11h as 2h por vezes a irmã tem ajudado. Neste negócio consegue uma receita de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por dia, poupa semanalmente através do sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique). Esta actividade aprendeu com a sua mãe que também desenvolve a mesma a mais de 20 anos.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para início da sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. No futuro deseja continuar com os estudos e solicitar mais créditos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria N. was born in Matola city, in Maputo province. She is a 30-year-old widow with 2 children who are 10 and 5 years old. She finished 9th grade and stopped studying because she was pregnant. She lives with her children in her parents’ home, and she financially maintains 3 siblings who live with them. She left Matola for Boane when she was a child. She has had her own business for 3 years, she works alone from 11 until 2, but sometimes her sister helps her. She earns about 2.000.00mt to 3.000.00mt a day through this business and she saves her money in a traditional savings system called (Xitique). She learned to save money this way from her mother, who has been involved in the system for 20 years. She has never had loans with other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through friends that are clients of this institution. This is her first loan and has a value of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, steel, sand and other materials) in order to begin her work. She is committed to paying this loan in order to be able to access loans in the future. In the future she would like to continue her education and take out more loans in order to finish her project.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has two children with her husband Marlou. Her oldest child is only eight years old. She is 30 years old and farms for a living. She cultivates her field for rice crops. She shared that her rice crops are starting to grow now and need extra care and additional farm inputs. She aims for a quality harvest and to help herself.

She applied for a loan of Php 11, 000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. With this loan, Rosalie will be able to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies so she could achieve quality harvest.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Estella owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month. In 2005, Estella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Estella is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita D. is a 67-year-old entrepreneur from Tala, Caloocan City. She is now a widow and lives with her son and grandchildren.

Lucita manages a glass/aluminum workshop located along the national highway, where her son is the chief worker, along with two other assistants. Lucita contracts with customers while her son and her two other employees do the hard work. Their shop fabricates and installs aluminum and glass doors, windows, and building panels. They earn more than 28,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lucita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is on her 16th loan cycle and has applied for a 30,000 PHP loan to sustain her business.

She hopes to have a bigger workshop someday so she can help employ more people in their community.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Glass display cases

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
32-year-old Ronald is a diligent farmer. He plants rice on his farm. He does his best when it comes to farming because it gives him and his wife food to eat and clothes to wear, and it supplies their other needs. Ronald has only been married for about four months now. He doesn’t have any children yet but looks forward to having one.

Ronald joined CEVI in 2008. He likes its program, especially the low interest rate of 2%. Now he is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies his farm needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.pt:
José Bernardo Estêvão nasceu no distrito de Murrupula, na Província de Nampula no norte de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, casado pai de 3 filhos de 20,14 e 7 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Parou de estudar depois de ter concluído o ensino primário porque foi capturado para cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família em Boane desde 1981. Sustenta a sua mãe enviando lhe produtos de primeira necessidade.

Saiu de Nampula em 1981 para Boane com a sua família transferido pelos serviços e depois de cumprir com o serviço militar, decidiu continuar no Ministério da defesa como chefe de secção. Passa já 15 anos a desempenhar esta função, aufere um salário de 5.380.00mt por mes poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra e ferro) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os créditos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro deseja, solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e construir uma cozinha através de material convencional.
texts.en:
José Bernardo Estêvão was born in Murrupula district in Nampula province, in north Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married and has 3 children who are 20, 14 and 7 years old. All of his childen go to school. Jose stopped going to school after he finished primary school because he was called to complete his obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his family in Boane and has lived there since 1981. He also takes care of his mother by sending her necessary goods. He left Nampala in 1981 because he was transferred by the military. After he completed his military service he decided to continue working for the Ministery of Defense as a section manager. He has been working in this job for 15 years, and he earns 5.380.00mt per month and is able to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku and is for 15.000.00mt, which he will use to buy construction material (bricks, cement, sand, rocks and steel) to continue working on his project. His previous loans were for 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt and 15.000.00mt and were all used for construction. In the future he would like to apply for more loans in order to finish his project and build a kitchen out of modern materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Seangneng

texts.en: Mrs. Seangneng K. lives in Troey Troeng village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  Her husband, Mr. Seng Kheng, helps her in the business. On this farm, Mrs. Seangneng K. faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate rice. Thus, Mrs. Seangneng K. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to support the field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is a mother of six children. One of her children is a garment factory worker, four are beauticians and the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a 47-year-old businessman. He is married to Teresa and blessed with five children. Most of them are adult-aged; some are married, and some still live with them. They live in the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. Aside from being a farmer, Domingo helps his wife in vending different kinds of native cakes. Teresa is the one who cooks, and he is the one who vends. They help each other in making their business successful so that they can provide for the needs of their family.

Domingo, along with his wife, ventures into producing and selling native delicacies which they sell in their village. Domingo is borrowing a loan in the amount of at least 4,000 PHP for the growth of their business. As the head of the family, he also wishes to help their children in case they are in need. He wishes to obtain a loan to be used as additional capital to purchase needed materials for their business. It will be a big help for the maintenance of their business.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
To help her husband meet their needs, Marieta indulged herself in taking care of their piggery. Her sow recently gave birth to ten little piglets. Marieta is feeding her hogs with feed, and now they are consuming more. She hopes to avail of a loan of at least 4,000 PHP for additional capital to buy supplies of feed for her hogs and sow. Aside from feed, she also needs to buy medicines for their protection and healthy growth. She hopes that her loan will be provided because it will be very helpful to her business as well as to her family.

Marieta is a married businesswoman who lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Her husband is working on their farm as another source of income for them. They have no children yet, but they have lots of hopes and dreams for their future. They hope that their business will continue to be progressive for their future family’s welfare.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy supplies of feed

loans.name: Enarcisa

texts.en: Enarcisa, 43 years old, is a mother of three children. She has been married to her husband Lito since 2000. Her oldest child is now twenty-two years old. A rice farmer for some time now, she loves spending time at her farm. Her goal is always to produce a quality harvest so she can sell better and also feed her family. Enarcisa is a member of CEVI and now has the opportunity to avail of its financial service. She is applying for a loan of 11,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Gil who is engaged in a trucking business and they have five children of whom most are presently studying. Their family lives in the village of Sitio Guingab, Tumauini, Isabela.

Carmelita ventures into the selling of various kinds of soap in her village and from her business she generates an income that is enough to meet the needs of their children.

Carmelita is borrowing PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital to buy more soaps for her retailing business. She hopes to obtain her loan to purchase more items to offer to her customers. It will surely make her business more profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to purchase more soap to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is a vegetable vendor for two years in their village. She sells her products on a door-to-door basis. She also grows vegetables in her garden and sells them whenever they are ready. Marilyn is hoping to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 to have an additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell.  With her patience in vending, she is generating an income of PHP300 daily, which is sufficient for the daily needs of her family. She hopes that she can maintain her business and for it to grow. 

Marilyn is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Edgar, who is a farmer, and blessed with three children. Their eldest, Edmarie, is 11 years old followed by Edmar, who is 7 years old. Their youngest is Denmark, who is 4 years old. Their three children are presently studying in elementary school. She hopes to give them a complete education with the help of her business. Their family lives in the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline C. is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child who is only five years old. She invested in rice farming and shared that her business is going well. She works hard at her farm because she wants to provide for her family and save up for her child’s future. Being a member of CEV, an MFI in the Philippines and a KIVA partner, she can avail of its financial service. She is applying for a loan of PHP12,000, which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for the laborers who help at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is engaged in vending vegetables in their village. She sells her products three times a week in the market and she is thankful that she helps her husband with her simple business. Josefina has a vegetable garden in their backyard where she gets some of the vegetables she sells. For more income, she also purchases additional vegetables to retail. Josefina also accepts laundry business whenever she is not in the market and this gives her an extra income. 

Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 as her additional capital to further grow her business. She will use it to buy more vegetables to sell in the market. This will help her earn more income to use for the allowances of her children who are all studying.

Josefina is very blessed to have five intelligent children. Her three elder children are scholars of the Local Government Unit and she is only supporting the tuition fees of her two younger children who are both in elementary school. Josefina is married to Felomeno, who earns an income being a caretaker of an eight-hectare farm. The couple hopes for a good future for their child. That’s why they also do their part as parents to provide their other needs. Their family lives happily in the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes A. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 48 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Lourdes owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa M. is from the village of Block 14 Lot 1, NHA Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Nimfa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a specialized retail business selling dried fish, oils and used clothing products in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Armando Joao

texts.pt:
Armando João B. nasceu em distrito de Chimoio, província de Manica, tem 38 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos com 08, 05 e 03 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Fez 3º ano do Instituto Industrial, parou porque teve que começar a trabalhar para sustentar a família. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Saiu de Chimoio para Boane em 1999 quando foi transferido pelos serviços, pouco tempo depois construiu a sua própria residência onde vive com a família ate hoje. É funcionário da Electricidade de Moçambique e trabalha como electricista montador há 08 anos fazem 08 horas diárias de segunda a sexta-feira. Aprendeu o trabalho em Chimoio em 1998. O seu rendimento mensal e de 7.465,00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum no final de cada mes.

Nunca teve crédito em outras instituições de financeiras e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar areia, cimento, chapas, barrotes, ferro, pedra e arame, para concluir a sua obra. Conheceu a Hluvuku porque e vizinho da sucursal de Boane.

Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para mobilar a casa e abrir um negócio.
texts.en:
Armando João B. was born in the Chimoio district in Manica province. He is 38 years old, married and the father of 3 children, who are 8, 5, and 3 years old. His oldest child attends school. Armando went to school up until his 3rd year of the Industrial Institute, but stopped his studies because he had to work in order to support his family. He lives in his own home and is not financially responsible for anyone except his immediate family. He left Chimoio for Boane in 1999 when he was transferred with the [military] service. A short time after that he built his own home where he still lives with his family. He is an employee of Mozambique Electricity company where he works as an electrician. He has worked there for 8 years, for 8 hours a day from Monday through Friday. He learned how to do this work in Chimoio in 1998. His monthly salary is 7.465,00mt and he is able to save a little each month. He has never had a loan with any other financial institution and this is his first loan with Hluvuku, for 15.000,00mt. He will use the money to buy sand, cement, steel, rocks and other building materials to finish his project. He heard about Hluvuku because he lives next to the Boane branch. He is committed to paying his loan off on-time in order to qualify for other loans to furnish his home and to open a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a specialized retail business buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 62 years old, is married, and has ten adult children.

Nena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Nena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia O. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Letecia is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants a rice crop to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a local building worker who travels everywhere around his commune to work in construction. They have been married for years and are the parents of three children, all of whom are students. The rice harvest season approaches; Ngin S. is looking for capital to buy rice in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to resell for profit

loans.name: Nerea Albertina

texts.pt:
Nerea Albertina D. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 28 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 4 anos de idade. Estuda 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane. Vive na casa própria em Boane com seu irmão, e para alem de filho não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane em 2002 com seus pais, porque antes viviam numa casa de aluguer. É oficial numa organização de apoio humanitária (Kulima) há mais de 2 anos, faz em media cerca de 8 horas de trabalho por dia, aufere um salário de 4.300.00mt por mes consegue poupar na conta bancária e através de sistema de poupança rotativo (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º crédito no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros). Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 5.000.00 e 10.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro, pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma nova residência, onde passara os momentos de lazer com a sua família.
texts.en:
Nerea Albertina D. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is 28, single, and the mother of a 4-year-old son. She studied through 12th grade at the Joaquim Chissano high school in Boane. She lives in her own home in Boane with her brother. She doesn't support anyone else besides her son. She left Maputo for Boane in 2002 with her parents because they lived in a rented home. She has been employed with a humanitarian organization (Kulima) for more than 2 years. She works 8 hours a day on average. She makes a wage of 4,300 meticais per month, and she manages to save some in a bank account through a rotating savings system called Xitique. She has never had a loan with another banking institution. She became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is her 3rd loan, and it is for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction material (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.). Her previous loans were for 5,000 and 10,000 meticais which she used for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to request more loans to construct a new home, where she will spend her free time with her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Posing with a great smile together with her products is Mrs. Lina T., 52 years of age, married and a resident of Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with five children and most of them are presently working abroad. Only one is still living with her.

As an optimistic and motivated micro-entrepreneur, Lina operates in different types of business like direct-selling, production, and even in networking activity. With her husband’s support, she has now been engaged in Glutathione soap production for a year already. This time she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month from her beauty soap production.

Now Lina is planning to deal in a new product from Wellness and Fitness Corporation with its coffee as the star product.

As a member of Paglaum MPC for one year, she is now enjoying our products and services, especially our loan. She is applying for P20,000 as her new loan amount to add to her revolving capital for her new line of business dealing in Wellness and Fitness coffee. She is hoping that someday she will become a stockist of these food supplement products.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her coffee business

loans.name: Jureta

texts.en:
Jureta O. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old. Jureta is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Jureta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jureta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jureta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jureta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the only loan taken out by Jureta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios D. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Remedios owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Obellie

texts.en:
Mrs. Obellie A. M., 36 years of age, is married and is a resident of 54-D Mabini-Laurel St.,  Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with three children of whom two are now in their high school years and the other one is still in the elementary grades. Although separated from her husband, she is still full of hope about her ability to support her three children.

For her source of income, Obellie engaged in a business dealing in RTW (ready-to-wear clothes), bags and imported perfumes. She started this kind of business ten years ago and has been able to sustain her family even in time of crisis. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P15,000 from her business activity which is sufficient to support the family needs.

Aside from that, Obellie also earns an income from a newspaper publication called “Misamis Weekly” which has ten years of existence already in this city. They started this business with a capitalization of P15,000 only.

As a new member of Paglaum MPC under the regular loan program, Obellie is privileged enough to obtain her first loan of P20,000 to add to her revolving capital for her RTW, bags and imported perfumes business. The proceeds of this loan will be used to support her family’s food needs, educational needs and as savings for preparing for the education of her three children in college in the near future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Domingos Xavier

texts.pt:
Domingos Xavier T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, capital de Moçambique tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 19, 17, 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 4º ano de seminarista dos padres da igreja católica não continuou devido a falta de meios financeiros, porque perdeu os pais muito cedo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém além da sua família.

Nunca mudou de residência, construiu no terreno deixado pelos pais depois da morte. Tem um negocio próprio desde 1962, aprendeu no tempo colonial com os portugueses, vende mais cerveja que custa 25.000.00mt. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mes e poupa algum no banco comercial Barclays.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições de créditos, conheceu a Hluvuku através das mobilizações feitas pela supervisora da sucursal de Boane. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria da sua loja (refrescos, cerveja e outros) para responder a procura que é cada vez crescente e consequentemente os seus rendimentos. Os seus primeiros empréstimos foram de 5.750,00mt,15.000.00mt, 25.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende solicitar empréstimos para reiniciar actividade de criação e venda de patos, actividade que vem desenvolvendo de uma forma menos intensa.
texts.en:
Domingos Xavier T. was born in Matola, Province of Maputo, capital of Mozambique, he is 56 years old, he is married and has 3 children who are 19, 17, 14 years old, they all go to school. He studied up to the 4th year of seminary of catholic church, but couldn't finished because of lack of financial resources, because he lost his parents too early. He lives in his own house with his family and he doesn't support any other relative. He never moved from his home and built in the same land his parents left after their death. He has his own business since 1962, that learned during the colonial times with the Portuguese, he sells more beer that costs 25.000MT. And gets a profit of 4.500MT a month and is able to save some of it at Barclays commercial bank. He never had any other loans with other institutions, he learned about Hluvuklu thru walks done by the supervisor of the Boane branch. This is his 5th loan for 15.000MT which he expects to use to buy merchandise for his store (beverages, beer and others) to answer the increasing demand and therefore his income. His first loans were for 5.750MT, 15.000MT, 25.000MT and 18.000MT all for the same activity. In the future he wants to request more loans to start again the activity of raising ducks, which is an activity that he has been working on in a less intense way.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beverages and beer

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra C. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Alejandra is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a specialized retail business buying and selling firewood in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alejandra from HSPFI. It is Alejandra's discretion to limit her loan amount to 11,000 PHP. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong C. N. is a married 25-year-old village woman who currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She runs her business in the market and earns approximately $3 a day.  This humble couple has a lovely young child who isn't yet enrolled in school. Kong C. N. also owns a piece of land upon which she grows vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase a water pump for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump the water for her crop

loans.name: Elisa Augusto

texts.pt:
Elisa Augusto B. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 12 e 6 anos de idade. Fez 9ª classe, não continuou na altura por falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende regressar a escola no próximo ano. Vive na casa própria em Boane com a sua família, o marido trabalha como pintor. Sustenta a sua sogra que vive em Inhambane enviando dinheiro, para compra de produtos alimentares.

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em 1992 com o seu esposo, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha num Orfanato (casa do Gaiato) como cozinheira a 9 anos, entra a 7h ate as 17h e aufere um salário de 4.000.00mt, onde poupa algum por mes na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua colega. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( Blocos,chapas de zinco, cimento, areia e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de todos para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se a pagar bem este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos afim de concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Elisa Augusto Baya was born in the Province of Inhambane, south of Mozambique, she is 37 years old, she is married and has 3 children who are 14, 12 and 6 years old. She finished the 9th grade and wasn't able to finish school due to lack of financial resources, but she expects to return to school next year. She lives in her own house in Boane with her family, her husband works as a painter. She also supports her mother in law who lives in Inhambane sending her money to buy food. She left Inhambane in 1992 and went to Maputo with her husband, looking for better live conditions. She works at an orphanage (casa do Gaiato) as a cook for the past 9 years, she enters at 7am and leaves at 5pm and earns a salary of 4.000MT, and she is able to save some money every month in her bank account. She never had any other loans, and learned about Hluvuku thru a co-worker. This is her 4th loan for 15.000MT which she expects to use to buy construction material (blocks, cement, zinc sheets, sand and others) to keep on building her house. The other previous loans were for the same activity. She promises to pay well this loan in order to access to more loans in the future, finish her house and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, 28 years old, has three children with her husband, Carlos. She is into rice farming. In spite of experiencing difficulties, she still works hard to ensure that her crops are growing well. She aims to produce a quality harvest.

Geraldine joined CEVI in 2008 and thinks that the low interest rate is really helpful. Now she is requesting a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and other things. Receiving this loan will really help Geraldine achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cordelina

texts.en:
Cordelina B., 47, from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cordelina owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main income comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Cordelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cordelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia R. is from the village of Talisay. She is 58 years old, is married, and has four children: three of them are adults and the youngest is school-aged. Delia owns and operates a business providing electronic services such as appliance repair and video karaoke assembly to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and also to support the education of her youngest child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electronic materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita S. is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Esterlita owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S. is a 52-year-old farmer and a widowed mother. She is blessed with two kids; both are working in a garment factory. Tuy S. inherited farmland from her grandmother and she grows different kinds of crops. In the past, Tuy S. has always hired the neighbor’s cow for the chore of plowing the farmland. Now she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy her own cow

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo L. runs a food stall selling a la carte grilled meat like pork, chicken feet, chicken liver and other grilled products in his community. He is 35 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. Eduardo has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Raimundo M., nasceu em Manica, província de Manica, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos com 06, 03 e 01 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Frequenta 10ªclasse na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano e pretende continuar com estudos no nível superior. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta também um irmão que vive com ele.

Saiu de Manica para província de Maputo em 2002 com intenção de iniciar uma actividade comercial mais tarde foi buscar a sua família que residem juntos em Boane. Actualmente trabalha numa empresa de segurança (G4), faz cerca de 8 horas por dia e aufere um salário de 4.200.00mt por mes, poupa algum na sua conta bancária. 

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 8.500.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, para poder concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Raimundo M., was born in Manica, province in Manica, he is 29 years old, is married and has 3 children who are 6, 3 and 1 years old, the first one goes to school. Raimundo is on the 10th grade of Joaquim Chissano High School and wants to continue studying and go to college. He lives in his own house and besides his family, he supports a brother who lives with them. He left Manica in the province of Maputo in 2002 in order to start a commercial activity and then he went to look for his family and they live all together now in Boane. Currently he works in a security company (G4), he works close to 8 hours a day and earns a salary of 4.200MT a month, and is able save some money in his bank account. He never had loans with other institutions, and learned about Hluvuku thru friends. This is his 4th loan for 15.000MT, that he expects to use to buy construction material (cement, iron, doors and others) to keep on building his house. The previous loans were for 6.000MT, 8.000MT and 8.500MT, all for the same activity. In the future he expects to request more loans to finish his house and offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron and others)

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn E. is from the village of Zone 2, San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Masjed Wali Asr Group

texts.en: This is the Masjed Wali Asr Group made up of four members. Gull Agha is the group leader of Masjed Wali Asr Group. He is a young boy who is a driver. other four members have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Marzia who is the second member of Masjed Wali Asr Group is busy in weaving. The third member, Nafis Gull, is also busy in weaving and the last member, Sughra, is busy with embroidery work. All of them want to increase their stock and buy some other tools. Gull Agha is sure that they can repay the loan on time and he can control the whole group. He would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan. They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase stock and buy tools

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina B. is from the village of Potol. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Marcelina owns and operates a business running a food stall selling snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the daily needs of her family. The persons included in the picture with Marcelina are her helpers in the business and the owner of the next stall. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (10117070012) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phúc Lộc 07 (3).


C. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, C. operates a family member's business raising chickens for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.
