In 2003, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.604.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby chicks to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will be used to purchase more baby chicks to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by C. from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Bùi Thị L. (10117070016) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 5.886.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117070013) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Minh T. (10117070015) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6.322.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (10117070012) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phúc Lộc 07 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.604.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Bùi Thị L. (10117070016) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.886.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117070013) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Minh T. (10117070015) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.322.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase more baby chickens

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em K. is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married to Hornten, age 32. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have two school-aged children. Em K. says that the roof of her house was cracked by water during a period of heavy rainfall. She is looking for a loan to replace her roof.

loans.use: to replace her damaged roof

loans.name: Jovymar

texts.en:
Jovymar A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 18 years old, married, and has 1 child who is an infant. To make a living, Jovymar owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovymar is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jovymar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovymar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdll Qader

texts.en:
This is Abdll Qader, son of A. W.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working and talented man. He works in Kabul and has been working in agriculture. He has not been able to buy more seeds and other necessary things for his farming.

He applied for an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to start working on his farmland and making a good income for his family. He hopes that after completing his stock, he can be more successful in his life. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for his land

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: A. Akouélé est née en 1959 et est mariée à NADOHOUENOU Damien, un chauffeur poids lourds. Le couple a quatre enfants et vit au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, il y a de cela 6 mois. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouélé n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. C'est depuis 22 ans que Akouélé vend du charbon de bois et des fagots de bois qu'elle livre à domicile. Akouélé s'approvisionne à Sêto au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître davantage son fonds de roulement et faire face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Akouélé sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouélé A. was born in 1959 and is married to Damien NADOHOUENOU, a truck driver. The couple has four children and has been living in the Fidjrossè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for six months. All four children attend school and live with their parents. The couple supports the family together. Akouélé never attended school and, for 22 years, has been selling charcoal and bundles of firewood that she home delivers. She gets her supplies in Sêto in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, and already benefited from two loans which were repaid without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and meet high customer demand, Akouélé is seeking another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Like many Cambodians, Mrs. Soeu S. is a rice cultivator.  She has been working in this sector since 2000. She and her husband were married a year ago and have no children. They grow rice on their own farmland, which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they generate an income of around US $3 per day. Soeu S. is requesting a loan for her husband to buy a bamboo ladder to climb palm trees and tap palm juice, which he will then sell. Her husband is pictured in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a bamboo ladder to climb a palm tree and tap palm juice

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad S. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Natividad owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as an additional working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites S. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lê Thị's Group

texts.en:
B. Lê Thị (10107070058) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they both are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 03 (3).


B. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, B. works in someone else's business manufacturing & selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members.  B. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.578.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị P. (10107070059) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business irunning a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Lê Thị (10107070058) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm được chế tạo thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2006, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị P. (10107070059) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Auma

texts.en: Auma H. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase water and soda to sell in the restaurant. Auma is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase water and soda to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: C. Florentine est née en 1950 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Florentine vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou. Mariée à GOGAN GNANHOUI Boniface, un greffier au Tribunal, Florentine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Florentine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Florentine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis 4 ans, afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Florentine vend des habits pour enfants et des sacs. Florentine vend ses articles par le système de distribution et s'approvisionne à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. En vue d'agrandir son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Florentine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
C. Florentine was born in 1950 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since birth, she has been living in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou. Married to GOGAN GNANHOUI Boniface, a Tribunal clerk, Florentine is the mother of six children, who are all in school. Three of the children are in her care. She lives alone with her children and is the sole support of the family. She halted her studies in secondary school. For four years, to provide for her children, she has been selling bags and clothing for children. She sells her goods through the distribution system. She stocks up in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans. With the aim of expanding her business and satisfying her customers further, she’s requesting another ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and some bags

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 22-year-old S.’s daily routine, something she and her husband learned to do from a grandmother. Her husband appears in the photograph because she was not available that day. S.'s husband also takes time to climb palm trees to tap juice, so she is requesting a loan to purchase a palm step for him to climb the trees.

loans.use: To purchase a palm step for her husband to climb palm trees

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic M. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 30 years old. Marvic is widowed and has 3 infant-aged children.

To make a living, Marvic operates a computer services business for local community members. Marvic also runs a t-shirt printing business.

Marvic joined HSPFI to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvic successfully repaid his first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI.which he invested in expanding his business.

Marvic is requesting his second loan from HSPFI, for 8000 PHP, to use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maricel R. N., 26 years old, is married and is a resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is married to an overseas seaman who is now currently working abroad. She is blessed with one child who is still a minor.

With a passion for business, Maricel decided to engage in business in order not to depend solely on the allotment from her husband. She started her rice retailing business two years ago with capitalization from her savings. Her first customers were her relatives and close friends and she has been able to sustain this business until this time. Presently, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month.

With a good credit record from her 1st loan of P15,000 she is now given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P30,000 to add to her capital. Now she is very happy in joining the Coop because she has learned many things, especially in our savings education program, which are very helpful not only for her but also for her child.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindan

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.

Mary is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase other bags of sugar and charcoal to sell.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop and pay school fees for her children.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar and charcoal to sell.

texts.en:
Elina M. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Elina is married and has one child in school.

To make a living, Elina runs a variety (sari-sari) store. Her main source of income comes from selling different products to the local community. Elina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elina joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elina successfully repaid her first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Elina is requesting her second loan of 8000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
