loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: N. Marguerite est née en 1959 et est mariée à HINKATI Antoine, un agent de sécurité. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et réside depuis 22 ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marguerite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par les deux conjoints. Marguerite n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a dix ans de cela que Marguerite mène comme activité la vente de glacières dans son quartier et aussi de nourriture (riz et haricot) au Collège Père Aupiais de Cotonou. Marguerite s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Marguerite voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Marguerite sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Marguerite was born in 1959 and is married to HINKATI Antoine, a security guard. The couple has four children who are all in school. They have resided in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 22 years. Marguerite lives together with her children and husband. The couple supports the family jointly. Marguerite never went to school. For ten years, she has been running a business selling insulated containers in her district and also food (rice and beans) at a middle school called Père Aupiais de Cotonou. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. She would like to expand her business and to satisfy her customer more. This is why she’s requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coolers and sacks of rice and beans

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.en:
Wenceslao E. is from the town of Panay Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old. Wenceslao is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Wenceslao owns & operates a business providing motor services to local community members. Wenceslao has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Wenceslao joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenceslao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wenceslao is requesting a new loan of 33,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Wenceslao from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma D. is a 42-year-old woman from San Lazaro, Tala, Caloocan City.  She lives with her husband Gualberto, 43, a jeepney driver and their six children. Two of the children are now in college, one is in high school and another two are in grade school.

Welma sells firewood, charcoal and sawdust as household kitchen fuel.  She also sells bananas.  She earns a monthly net income of P2,500.00.  She saves her profits for the education of her children.  During rainy season, her items get soaked in rainwater, affecting her sales.

Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the later part of 2008, Welma has been enjoying its many benefits for its members, who are mostly housewives.  She is now on her fourth loan cycle with CCT.  She is expecting to receive a fresh loan from the cooperative of P8,000.00 that she will use as additional capital for her business. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talent family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is married and lives in the town of Isfara in Tajikistan. After getting married, the family's expenses started to accumulate and he started his own business selling foodstuffs. That was two years ago. Little by little he started stocking more products and, based on his customers requests, added items such as soft drinks and sweets. Abdulaziz is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to remodel and expand his grocery, allowing him to offer better service to his customers. Abdulaziz and his family thank you for your support.

To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting seaweed for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Ismadiyor

texts.en:
S. Ismadiyor lives in the town of Kanibadam in Tajikistan. He is 40, married and has three children. Ismadiyor is the only breadwinner for the family. He earns money by raising cattle and selling it on the local market. Ismadiyor sells the cattle to the local butcher shops. Currently Ismadiyor is thinking about increasing the size of his business because his current income is insufficient to provide for his family expenses. In order to be able to do that, he requires a loan of $1000 USD. Ismadiyor is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Ismadiyor’s business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: H. Denise est née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Denise est mariée à WANGNANNON Joseph, un militaire retraité et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Denise vit au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou depuis environs 49 ans, avec ses enfants et son mari. Denise vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Denise n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Denise vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte alimentaire, accompagnés de sauce et poissons) à côté de la "buvette berceau des intimes" à Gbégamey. Denise fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître sa clientèle, Denise sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé. Denise ambitionne plus tard acquérir sa propre parcelle et quitter la maison familiale.
texts.en:
H. Denise was born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to WANGNANNON Joseph, a retired soldier, and is the mother of five children who are all in school. For about 49 years, she has lived in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, where she still does with her children and husband. Denise comes to her husband’s aid to meet family expenses. To support herself and to provide for her family, she sells food (rice or pasta served with sauce and fish) next to a refreshments stand called Buvette Berceau des Intimes in Gbégamey. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from two loans, which have been repaid. To increase her working capital and to grow her customer base, she’s requesting a new loan from ALIDé. Later on, her ambition will be to acquire her own parcel and to leave the family house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of pasta, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie L. Sr. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Ronnie owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream and chicken. Ronnie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ronnie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ronnie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie N. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants avec en charge 2 de ses frères. Elle fait de la coiffure et aimerait renforcer ses activités. Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter ses ressources financières afin de mieux gérer son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Marie N. is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children, plus she has two of her brothers in her care. She is a hairdresser and would really like to bolster her business. This loan will enable her to increase her financial resources in order to manage her hair salon better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her hair salon

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 71 years-old and widowed with one adult child. Anita operates a service-based business providing pedicab services to local community members. Anita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et du petit commerce de produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de rentabiliser son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Amy D. is 44 years of age, married and the mother of 6 children. She does cattle fattening and petty trading of foodstuffs. Her aim is to make her business profitable in order to provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To engage in cattle fattening and petty trading

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf has eight children. With the help of his business, he has been able to provide for his family but he needs to continue to grow to offer his daughters a better education and to support the household. He started his business with skills he learned at a young age. Yusuf has been processing and selling prunes for more than 15 years. Yusuf learned quickly and was good at the job, so he decided to continue with it. He is a very hard worker and a family man without vices. He sought out the microfinance program in hopes of finding the means to support his business. Yusuf is seeking a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni to purchase prunes to be able to grow his business and improve sales. He and his wife appreciate your support in helping them get ahead and continue to better themselves to be able to offer their children a better quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase prunes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin, Mis. Occ.. She is 41 years-old and married with three three school-aged children. Vivian owns and operates a service-based business operating a motorcycle "habal-habal" in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Vivian joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle and also to invest a portion of the loan to another business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Vivian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Mbenda

texts.fr: Mbenda F. est mariée, 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la restauration et aimerait renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’avoir une autonomie financière concernant cet activité.
texts.en:
Mbenda F. is 43years of age, married and the mother of 4 children. She is active in catering and would like to strengthen her business. Her aim is to have financial independance with regard to this business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do catering

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. is from the village of Seti, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, soft drinks and toothpaste in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lilia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en: Jamileh is a widowed mother of three children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 1994 to earn income for her family. Today, Jamileh is requesting a loan of $1,000 to renovate her sewing machine to meet the demand of her clients and produce more tailoring products.

loans.use: To renovate her sewing machine

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Y. est âgée de 39 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de divers produits alimentaires comme le mil, l’oseille et le haricot. En même temps, elle fait de l’élevage bovin. Les revenus générés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins en nourriture, en santé et en scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Khady Y. is 39 years of age, widow and the mother of 6 children. She is engaged in the commerce of micelleneous foodstuffs like millet, sorrel and beans. She does livestock farming at the same time. The profit generated allow her to take care of the feeding, health and school needs of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do trading of miscelleneous foodstuffs and livestock

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hassan, a 39-year-old married man with four children, has been working in construction since 1998 to provide better living conditions for his family. Demand for his services is great, so he is requesting a loan to buy wood scaffolding for his business in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy wood scaffolding for his business

loans.name: Marième Gorgui

texts.fr: Marième Gorgui D. est une dame de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt développer son petit commerce de haricot et oseille et l’élevage ovin qu’elle fait. Cet activité lui permet de subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marieme Gorgui D. is a 55 year old lady, married and the mother of 6 children. She wants to grow her small business that she is engaged in; beans, sorrel and livestock farming with this loan. This business allows her to provide improved living conditions, health and schooling for her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do petty trading  of micelleneous foodstuffs and livestock.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat T. is a very hardworking and independent woman. A married mother of two children, she started her sheep-breeding business 10 years ago. Because this business brings good income to her family, Jannat wants to buy more sheep to increase her profits and is therefore requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of small sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Siga Thioubou

texts.fr: Siga Thioubou D. est une femme mariée de 49 ans, mère de plus de 10 enfants. Elle travaille avec ses fils qui sont installés dans la capitale. Ils vendent divers produits alimentaires comme le haricot. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de soutenir ses enfants et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité.
texts.en:
Siga Thioubou D. is 49 year old married woman and the mother of more than 10 children. She works with her children who are settled in the capital. They sell various foodstuffs like beans. This loan will enable her to strengthen her business in order to support her children and to improve their living conditions, health and schooling.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do petty trading of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and married with five children, who are all schooling. She hopes to be a mother of graduates.

Sarah sells eggs and loaves of bread, both wholesale and retail, in her community of Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. With her combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family.

Sarah is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more loaves of bread and eggs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread and eggs to sell

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina A. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Lucina owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lucina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for fishing, such as nets, and for pumpboat use. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. Lucina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for fishing, such as nets, and materials for pumpboat

loans.name: Takhminakhon

texts.en:
T. Takhminakhon is 42 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman who started her business in 1999 and has become very experienced and skilled in breeding sheep. She has applied for a loan of $1,100 to expand her flock. Takhminakhon believes this will help her generate greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she plans to buy additional sheep and increase her income further. We hope that you will play an important role in Takhminakhon's family life, because she deeply appreciates the trust and support lenders give her.

loans.use: To buy additional sheep to expand a small business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 45 years old, married and has six children ranging in age from 7 to 23. Her husband is a teacher and they live in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker who makes a living selling jewelry. She has applied for a loan for N65,000 to buy more jewelry to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a big jewelry shop. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Education is the most important gift Mutabar and her husband can give their three dear children. They believe this because they are responsible parents who work very hard at farming so their children can finish school, an opportunity they never had because they were so poor. Mutabar has worked in agriculture since her wedding, and with the unconditional help of her husband, also buys and sells sheep to meet the family’s other needs. Despite this, she now finds herself with more expenses than expected, and would like a loan to increase the size of her flock. Mutabar and her family are hoping for a favorable response to their request.

loans.use: to expand a small business by buying more sheep.

loans.name: Tursinoy

texts.en:
Ever since their marriage, Tursinoy and her husband have made a living buying and selling sheep. They do their work with lots of care because they enjoy it and because it allows them to meet their expenses and provide an education for their son. This hard-working mother buys her sheep in nearby towns, feeding and raising them until they are large enough to sell. Her dream is to give her beloved son security and an education. She has applied for a loan to make this dream possible by buying more sheep. She needs your help, and thanks you in advance for your kind support.
