loans.use: To expand a small flock of sheep

loans.name: Oke

texts.en: Oke makes a living selling crates of eggs to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to increase her sales. She is a hard-working woman who is 30 years old, married and has no children. Her husband makes a living selling electrical materials in their home town of Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. Oke has applied for a loan for $350, which she will use to buy more crates of eggs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future by starting a poultry farm. She extends sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура Хасанова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Мастура более 11 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mastura H. lives in the Rumy district. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Mastura has been involved in sales at a market for over 11 years. She primarily sells food products. She is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
K. Parviz is 25 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years Parviz has been providing transport services. As a rule, he works only in his region. At the same time, with his wife's help, he raises cattle at home, which brings his family additional income.

Currently, Parviz’s truck needs repairing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS. Parviz promises to pay the loan on time, and thanks everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Muazama

texts.ru: Муазама Султанкулова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в местной строительной компании. Сама Муазама у себя дома занимается павишкой одежды под заказ. Кредит просит для закупа сырья чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Muazama S. lives in the Rumy district. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works at a local construction company. Muazama is involved in sewing clothing to-order at home. She is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline B. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale in the community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jacqueline joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional feed products to sell. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Awareness Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed A. S., Mamusu K. and Hannah K.. They have named their group, Awareness Group. This is the first loan this group is accessing from Kiva lenders through Kiva partner, Salone Microfinance Trust. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses in size and quality. Consequently, their sales and profit margins will improve, and they will be better able to support their school-aged children in terms of food, clothing, school fees, and other school-related charges.

Mohamed A. S. (pictured middle) is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He is 35 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife sells cooked rice and his children attend primary school. For the past eight years, Mohamed has sold palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), and rice. He will use this loan to buy more “barters” (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil and bags of rice.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina E. is from the city of Santa Cruz Tangub City. She is 51 years old. Avelina is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Avelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily making "BIBINGKA" (rice cakes) for sale in the local community. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Avelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Avelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale

location.town: santa cruz tangub city misamis occidental

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Rizal Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Margie is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Margie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Margie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby piglets to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Luma Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Luma Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by adding more goods into their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Adama K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in the village of Makalili, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 45 years old, married to a businessman and the two of them have three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is in Junior Secondary School. Adama has been a businesswoman for over 20 years now. She specialized in selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnut/peanuts. Adama will use this loan to buy bags of rice, beans, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is married with two children. Her elder child is 4 years old and the younger is 3 years old. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband sells sarongs at the market to support the family. They all live in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells groceries, drinks, and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase a grinding machine, foodstuffs, and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine, foodstuffs, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She is a committed LAPO client. She sells yams and has been in the business for five years. The profit from this trade enables her to support her husband, who is a motor repairman, in providing for the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase yams in bulk, as this attracts sales and increases her profit. With the loan, she plans to expand her yam business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Quick Help Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Luma Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL for each of them from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by buying more goods for their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Adama Kargbo (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in the village of Makalili, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately forty-five years old, married to a businessman, and the two of them have three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is in junior secondary school. Adama has been a businesswoman for over twenty years. She specializes in selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnuts. Adama will use this loan to buy bags of rice, beans, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn C. is from the village of Purok Piape, Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a home-based tailor and a married woman with 2 children. She's 44 years old. She has been involved in this business since 2004, where she provides, in collaboration with her husband, for the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to offer a variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a single man living with his family. He's 33 years old. He owns a private electric motor, which he has used to provide electricity for his town since 2007. He has been involved in this field for the past 10 years. Today, Issam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an electric cable to expand his work.

loans.use: To purchase an electric cable

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is excited to take his first loan with Kiva and believes that the loan will help him increase his capital. He sells yams and has been in this trade for five years. From this trade, he struggles to care for his immediate family.  Emmanuel needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase yam in bulk at a discount rate and be able to meet customers' demands while his capital and profit also increase. He is 32 years old, married with two children and resides in Delta state, Nigeria. He says thanks to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase yams to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is from the village of Rizal Jimenez Mis. Occ. She is 59 years old. Divina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a business venture operating specialized retail store.While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from making and selling "nipa" hut in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. Divina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Divina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle M. is from the village of Nacional Jimenez Mis. Occ. She is 31 years old. Annabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: True Go Last Group

texts.en:
These are members of the True Go Last group. They are small-scale business people in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, making more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Abdul A. G. (second from left). Abdul was born in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has two children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are still not of school-going age. Abdul manufactures mattresses out of grass. He has been producing mattresses for the local community for more than ten years now. With this loan, he will buy bags (empty rice bags into which the grass is inserted to make the mattresses). He will sell some of the bags and use some to produce more mattresses for sale.

loans.use: Buy working materials like empty rice bags

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is from the town of Poblacion, Clarin, Mis. Occ.. She is 32 years old. Juliet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials for the bakery. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials for the bakery

loans.name: Fredrick Otieno

texts.en:
Fredrick Otieno M. owns Domnsons Fashions and sells school uniforms, trousers and dresses to shops, schools, and customers at the market. He has been a tailor for 20 years and his business challenges are lack of funds, strong competition, and sometimes low customer demand. He is using the proceeds of KES 50,000 to buy materials for making school uniforms, dresses, and trousers.

In the future, he would like to open a shop where he can sell materials and expand his business. Fredrick has a wife and eight children ranging from nine to eighteen years of age and describes himself as hard-working and honest. He is the vice chairman of TSS borrowing group. He dreams of educating his children and building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making uniforms, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Milly Nalubega's Group

texts.en:
Milly is a 45-year-old single mother of seven children aged between 5 and 20 years. None of her children goes to school because she couldn’t come up with the school fees. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Milly takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water; they get three meals a day.

Milly incurs transport costs to and from Kiyembe. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Milly works seven days a week. She receives an average of 5 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of tailoring materials and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works from an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and medications.

Milly has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years, servicing her seventh loan. Milly joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a designing shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 40 years old, married, and takes care of one dependent who is 35 years of age.  Faustin lives in the Musanze district which is approximately 2 hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Faustin is a relatively new entrepreneur; he has owned his small shop selling a wide variety of goods including new clothes and some items used in in cooking since 2007, working from 7 AM to 6 PM every day.  

Faustin struggles to make a profit each month and believes that he does not carry enough variety of attractive goods. To this end, a small amount of additional capital would help his business to grow in a meaningful way, he believes. For that reason, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase these additional goods such as attractive dishes so that he may attract more and different customers and increase his sales in the process. If his notion to expand his product offering is successful, Faustin will be able to build his business and a more secure future for his family.

loans.use: A variety of goods including new clothes and some iftems used for cooking

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Purok Piape, Sinonoc Sinacaban Mis. Occ. She is 58 years old. Emma is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 68-year-old married woman with seven children aged between 15 and 40 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. Deborah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get it from villages. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Deborah works seven days a week .She receives an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.  She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 17th loan. Deborah joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Clenie

texts.en:
Clenie is 31, married, has three children and takes care of four dependents with ages ranging from 2 to 10. Clenie lives in the northern province of Rwanda in a place called Ruhengeli, approximately 2 hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.  Clenie is a proven businesswoman, she has had a shop selling a variety of goods since 1999. She works long hours; her shop is open from 8 AM to 6 PM every day.

Although Clenie has been in business since 1999, she struggles each month to make a decent profit and she believes that a small amount of additional capital to buy more and better inventory would change that for her.  For this reason, Clenie is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to purchase a variety of attractive goods for sale which she thinks her customers will want.   She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 26. She is married and has two children. Both of her wards are in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Industrious as she is, Agatha works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a seamstress by profession. Her shop is on one of the streets in her community. Agatha designs and sews dresses for her female clients. According to her, she has no apprentice yet. Agatha buys the fabrics from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to improve upon the quality of her services.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 37 years old, married with one child, and she takes care of two orphans from one of her relatives. She lives in Musanze district, which is approximately two hours drive from the capital city of Rwanda. This is her fourth successful year of selling a variety of goods in her small general store. Her shop is open from 7 a.m. until late in the evening hours every day. Floride is a hard worker for sure.

Floride is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital and purchasing needed goods at better prices in greater quantities. This will enable her to earn more profit and attract new customers with the added inventory items.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Floride will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her child plus the two orphans she takes care of now.

loans.use: To purchase goods at better prices in greater quantities

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Joyce is a trader. She trades in printed textiles. She sells in a shop by the roadside in her community and treks to sell. Joyce buys the textile goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Assiya

texts.en:
Assiya is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between 4 and 15 years. She lives in Northern Province, Rwanda, in the district of Musanze, which is approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

A seasoned businesswoman, Assiya has owned her computer repair house since 2001. The hours of her business require that shat she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day to properly service her customers. She employs one technician in her business.

Assiya is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing some computer materials for sale or for replacing the defunct materials found in computers which are brought to her for repair.

With this loan, Assiya hopes to make her business grow through adding more computers and computer equipment sales to go along with the service portion of her business. If her plan is successful, Assiya will continue to build a strong business and a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and computer supplies

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town in the Western Region of Ghana. Diana works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Diana is a trader. She trades in rubber/plastic products and utensils. She sells at the local market square. Diana buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rubber/plastic products

loans.name: Matiya's Group

texts.en: B. Matiya is the leader of his group in Ibanda. He is 36 years old and married with six children who are all in school. He has a retail shop in Omububaare trading centre that has been in operation for fifteen years. At the moment, Matiya is able to make approximately $43 in profits a week, and this enables him to take care of his family. He is a friendly man and determined, and this has enabled him to win more customers. In the future, he would like to turn his shop into a wholesale business, and also to have a happy and educated family. Matiya is seeking a loan to enable him to add more stock in his shop so that he can boost his business further.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more general merchandise.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old and is married with five children aged between 3 and 13 years. He lives in Northern Province, Rwanda, in the district of Musanze which is approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

It is in this area where Emmanuel has a barbershop in which he employs six people! This is his 4th year of successful operation in business and things are going strong. The barbershop requires that he work long hours: from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Emmanuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to buy some new equipment to replace the old. In addition, with the remaining money he will buy some additional machines for hair cutting in order to increase the number of employees and therefore the number of customers that patronize his business.

If this plan is successful, Emmanuel will be able to continue paying school fees and provide healthy food for his children. In addition he will be able to build a secure future for all five of them.

loans.use: To buy new equiment and supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is 50 years old, married and has eight children. She has been with LAPO for years with a good repayment record. She buys yams by the river and sells them nearby. She has been managing the business for eight years and with it sustains her family. With the increase in demand for the goods, she is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more yams in order to satisfy her customers' demands and also make more profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Stesuzanne Dieu Estmon Guide Group

texts.en:
The “Dieu est mon Guide” Group, which translates from French to “God is my guide”, is a made up of ten female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their 1st and 2nd loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 3rd loan. Inoise M. is one of two representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two young children ages 5 and 3yrs old.

This hardworking mom sells a variety of items but is most successful with fresh foods, including rice, beans, vegetables, dried fish and oils for cooking. Depending on the seasonal needs of her clients, she also sells notebooks, backpacks and sandals. She sells both in the local market and from a small stand in front of her home.

Iniose is thankful for these loans because it has allowed her to provide a better life for her children. She dreams of doing great things with her business to be able to give her family a brighter future. On behalf of Iniose, Dieu Est Mon Guide, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: To earn a livelihood, Joy sells jewelry in Ughelli, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes to own a big jewelry shop in the future. Joy is 49 years old and married with seven children. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make higher profits during this season. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Gorreth

texts.en:
Gorreth is a 45-year-old single mother of three children aged between 5 and 17 years. None of her children goes to school because she couldn’t raise school fees. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. Gorreth takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

She incurs transportation costs to and from Kawala. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Gorreth works seven days a week, receiving an average of twenty-five customers a day. She sells to all categories of people, at both retail and wholesale prices.

Gorreth owns a canteen at the Nakulabye Church of Uganda primary school. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of cooking oil, baking powder, charcoal and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works from an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and medication.

She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years, now servicing her seventh loan. Gorreth joined MCDT because it was near her home and the group was easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more baking powder and cooking oil. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger, and she would like to start distributing samosas, chapatti and pan cakes to different nearby schools.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, flour and baking powder

loans.name: Addo

texts.en: Addo is twenty-eight. He is married and has no children. He lives with his wife in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. Addo is a carpenter by profession. He has his shop by the roadside in his community. He makes all kinds of furniture – wardrobes, beds, chairs, etc. According to him, he has one apprentice currently under training. Addo buys the wood from sawmill firms and timber markets in nearby towns. He has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy working materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Itive

texts.en: Itive sells drinks, fried beef and pepper soup in his stall to make a living. He works long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs and necessities of his family. He hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. Itive is 50 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. He lives in Ughelli, Delta state, Nigeria. Itive hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. This is the high season for sales, and he hopes to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 50-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 20. All her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with seven people. Teopista takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets two meals a day.

Teopista doesn’t incur additional transportation costs to and from shopping, because she buys from people who get what she needs from surrounding villages. She has a small bar where she sells all types of beer and local gin. She sells to all categories of people, at both retail and wholesale prices. Teopista works seven days a week, receiving an average of thirty customers a day. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her because she works from a muddy place. Teopista‘s monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and residence, and feeding the family.

She has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her twelfth loan and working with the same group mates. Teopista joined MCDT because it was near her home and also to increase her capital. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and would like to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is a 36-year-old married mother of two children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most residents practice farming alongside other trading activities. 

Afua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells wheat with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells by hawking in the daytime in her community. Afua buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for 11 years and wants a loan to procure bags of wheat and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of wheat in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old, married and has three children. She sells yams on the riverbank and has been in business for two years. She is a faithful and a committed LAPO client. The profit from this trade enables her to assist her husband in providing for the needs of the family. 

She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase yams in bulk as this attracts sales discounts for her, thereby increasing her profit. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Fabiano's Group

texts.en:
S. Fabiano, 45, is the leader of his loan group in Ibanda. He is a friendly and a hardworking man with a wholesale shop, which has been his business in Kazo trading centre for 18 years. Being in a very competitive environment, Fabiano has managed to keep and win more customers due to his good customer care skills. 

His dream is to have a more successful business, where he can make more profits compared to the 300,000/= that he makes every week. He is the father of four children and cares for four other dependents, and he would like to see each one of them attain the best education available to them. 

Fabiano is in need of a loan to help add more inventory to his shop to ensure a steady supply.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and married with nine children. Her husband is a drink distributor and he also supports the home. 

Esther sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her family. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy Q. is from Silangga Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Lucy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to local community members. Lucy has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from the village of Eastern Pob. Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Eva is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, sugar, candies, salt, vinegar, soft drinks and toothpaste, in the local community. Eva has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 30 years old and married with two children. The eldest child is nine years old and the youngest child is seven years old. Felix lives in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria.  He sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to his customers. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. 

He hopes for a loan in the amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase a freezer to enable him to sell cold drinks to his customers. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer in order to sell cold drinks

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
El socio ESTANISLAO pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
El socio tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos, los mayores son independientes y el menor estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil.

El socio requiere el préstamo para la educación de su hijo menor y para los gastos familiares. El hijo menor del socio esta estudiando en la ciudad del Cusco. El socio tiene que pagar la habitación, los libros, la alimentación, los pasajes, la ropa y los materiales que exigen los docentes a su hijo. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Estanilao is a member of the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. He is from the Calca province in the department of Cusco, which is located one hour from the province of Cusco. He is 68, married, and has four children. The older children are grown and independent. The youngest child is studying in the university to be a civil engineer. The member needs a loan for his youngest son’s education and for family expenses. His youngest son studies in the city of Cusco. The member has to pay for his housing, books, food, transportation, clothes, and the materials the professors require his son to have. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means. He promises to make his payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses for his son

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita J. is from the village of Rizal Jiminez Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Florita is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Florita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, sugar, candies,& toothpaste in the local community. Florita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joepet Jade

texts.en:
Joepet Jade D. is from the city of Las Aguadas, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old. Joepet Jade is single. To make a living, Joepet Jade owns and operates a business providing motorcycle passenger transport as a "habal-habal" in the local community. Joepet Jade has been in business for mor than one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Joepet Jade joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joepet Jade is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used purchase spare parts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joepet Jade from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Donatus

texts.en:
Donatus is 32 years old and married. He sells hair extensions, hair cream, etc. He is a stylist and has been in this business for years. He is very hardworking and he makes sure he has food on the table every day through his hard work. 

Donatus plans to increase his sales during this festive period. He is requesting for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair products to sell. Donatus hopes to be able to have a big vending stall in future. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To purchase hair products for resale

loans.name: Okeh

texts.en: To earn a livelihood, Okeh sells medicines in Ughelli, Delta state, Nigeria. He is 34 years old and married without children, but he hopes to have children very soon. His wife is a trader and she also supports the home. He hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. He hopes to own a maternity home in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Suyapa Ivonne

texts.es: Suyapa Ivonne tiene la edad de 25 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Sus deseos son de construir un lugar para establecer un restaurante en el que ella pueda cocinar ya que es uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos. Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas, venta de de Dvd y discos de audio, por lo que no solo en la calle tiene la venta de estos productos también en su casa. Hace más de  5 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de suficientes productos.
texts.en:
Suyapa Ivone is 25. Her purpose is to succeed in life by getting ahead with her business. The most important thing is to continue generating her family’s daily sustenance. Her wish is to build a place to set up a restaurant where she would be able to cook. That is one of her favorite pastimes. She sells phone cards, DVDs, and audio discs. She not only sells on the street, but she also sells these products in her house. Over five years ago she started the business because she needed to look for work. She decided to set up a small business. At the beginning she did not have the necessary experience for this business. But, with the passage of time, she acquired the ability to talk with her customers. The loan is for working capital to buy sufficient products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita B. is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Anecita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a business selling coconut wine "tuba" in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $112 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional "tuba" coconut wine for sale. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut wine (tuba) for sale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma R. is from the village of Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Alma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the motocycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda B. is from the city of Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Elda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elda owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Elda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $214 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jack Harrison

texts.es:
El socio JACK HARRISON pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural del departamento de Apuricma, provincia de Andahuaylas, pero radica en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  

El socio tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, es abogado.  El socio tiene un pequeño negocio de librería donde vende cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, papeles, borradores, reglas, etc.  

El socio requiere el préstamo para la implementación de su librería aumentando el capital del negocio. El socio en la librería también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, impresiones, anillados, empastados de cuadernos, etc. El socio quiere comprar en el futuro varias fotocopiadoras.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Jack Harrison belongs to the communal bank "VIRGIN ASUNTA", an affiliate of Kiva. He is from the department of Apuricma, province of Andahuaylas, but lives in the province of Calca, of the department of Cusco, located an hour inside the province of Cusco. Jack is 47 years old, he is married, he has two children, and is a lawyer. He has a small business, a bookstore where he sells notebooks, books, paper, mechanical pencils, rulers, erasers, etc. He requires the loan in order to enlarge the capital of his business. In his bookstore, he also offers a photocopying service, copies, ringed binders, hardcover notebooks, etc. He wants to buy several photocopiers for the future. He is very grateful for the opportunity offered by means of this loan and thus he promises to comply with re-payment according to the timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment the capital of his business, buying more supplies for his store

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is 35 years old and married with two children. He is a committed LAPO client and has been in the group for three years with a good record. Pius sells motorcycle parts. Through this business he is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan, he plans to expand his motorcycle spare parts business, which is now booming. To meet with high customer demand, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase parts in bulk. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie T. is from the city of LABUYO, TANGUB CITY. She is 41 years old. Tessie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito S. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Paquito owns and operates a business running a "sari-sari" retail store. He sells a variety of different products such as  shampoo, sugar, salt, toothpaste and sweet candies in the local community. Paquito has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Paquito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Paquito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Paquito is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his fifth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a thirty-two-year-old married mother of five children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities.

Matilda is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat. Matilda says she also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the goods from big cold stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat in bulk

loans.name: Young

texts.en: Young is married with four children and he is 36 years old. His eldest child is 9 years old and the youngest child is 7 years old. He sells VCDs (video compact discs) to make a living in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. The demand for his goods is high and he hopes to meet the needs of his customers. He hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is a food vendor. He runs a chop bar in his community. He prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Kofi has hired extra hands that work for him. Kofi buys foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc. from nearby towns. He has been in business for 16 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.
Kofi is 30 years old. He is divorced and has two children who are both in school. He lives with his children in a rented apartment in a community dominated by farming in the Western Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en:
Mylene Faith J.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked foods for daily meals. She is 24 years old, married and has one small child. She is from the village of San Juan Panaon. Mylene Faith has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mylene Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products

loans.name: Cosmas Ogola

texts.en:
Cosmas Ogola O. owns the Nyatike Emporium where he has been making and selling shoes for 16 years. He has three employees and his business is located in the Kangemi market. His challenges are too few customers and lack of funds. He is using this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy leather materials for making more shoes and soles. In the future, he want to expand his business and educate all his children. 
Cosmas is married and has three children. He describes himself as respectful and hardworking. He is the chairman of a TSS group.

loans.use: To buy leather materials and soles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and lubricants to sell

loans.name: Judith Nyanchoka

texts.en:
Judith Nyanchoka B. owns the Swiss Salon where she provides the services of hair weaving, plaiting, manicure, pedicure and blow-drying to walk-ins and her steady clients. Her business challenges are lack of water and inability to pay the rent. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a flat iron, tong and steam machine. Her dream is to open a big training salon and employ more workers.

Judith is married with two children and describes herself as sociable, friendly and honest. She is secretary of a TSS group.

loans.use: To buy a flat iron, tong and steam machine
